Gloomglow Mushrooms.name: Gloomglow Mushrooms
Gloomglow Mushrooms.description: A field of grass-like fungal filaments amid clusters of softly glowing, long-stalked mushrooms.
Gloomglow Mushrooms.disable: @Check[survival|dc:22|name:Clear Patch of Mushrooms|traits:environmental,fungus,hazard] (expert) to remove a 5-foot-patch without triggering the mushrooms.

action->Glowing Spores.name: Glowing Spores
action->Glowing Spores.description:
Trigger A creature moves into the mushrooms' space or damages the mushrooms. The mushrooms can't use this reaction if the damage was cold damage.

Effect The triggering creature and all creatures within 10 feet are sprayed with itchy, distracting, glowing spores and must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:22|traits:environmental,fungus,hazard] save. On a failed save, the creatures become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure) and take a -4 penalty to Stealth checks until the spores lose potency in 24 hours or are removed. This requires washing them off by bathing in water for a minute, a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Qw3fnUlaUbnn7ipC]{Prestidigitation} spell, or a similar measure allowed by the GM.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.eZL4B1P4H8hr1CAn]{Effect: Glowing Spores}

Grauladon.name: Grauladon
Grauladon.publicNotes:
Grauladons are vicious predators that appear crocodilian in form, but are in fact distant offshoots of dragonkind. They make their dens in the shallows of fetid ponds or isolated corners of larger bodies of water, usually in rural swamps or woodlands. Driven almost entirely by their base desire to feed, grauladons spend most of their time swimming leisurely underwater looking for prey such as fish or waterfowl. Possessed of a greed befitting their more majestic dragon cousins, grauladons often take down prey larger than they need, jealously guarding the corpses to keep scavengers away even as the meat rots. A typical grauladon is 16 feet long from its snout to the tip of its tail and weighs 1,500 pounds.

A grauladon's stench may seem supernaturally disgusting, but it is simply the result of the creature's fetid habitat and diet of rotting, waterlogged meat. As grauladons' exhalations bear a passing resemblance to dragons' breath, they have earned the nickname "mud drakes" from rural folk.

Grauladons can be found in both fresh and brackish water in most temperate climates. They prefer to lair in shallow waters, particularly where reeds or other foliage conceal their bulk from unsuspecting prey. Grauladons are highly territorial and won't tolerate other predators living or hunting near their homes.

action->Reactive Breath.name: Reactive Breath
action->Reactive Breath.description:
Trigger The grauladon takes damage from an adjacent creature.

Effect The grauladon uses Noxious Breath, including the triggering creature in the area.

action->Body Slam.name: Body Slam
action->Body Slam.description:
Requirements More than one enemy is adjacent to the grauladon.

Effect The grauladon swings its tail at each adjacent enemy and attempts to Trip each creature adjacent to it. It rolls only a single Athletics check and compares the result to the Fortitude DC of each target.

action->Deep Breath.name: Deep Breath
action->Deep Breath.description: A grauladon can hold its breath for 225 rounds (22-1/2 minutes).

action->Noxious Breath.name: Noxious Breath
action->Noxious Breath.description:
The grauladon hisses and unleashes a nauseating cloud of halitosis in a @Template[cone|distance:15]. Each creature in the area must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:18] saving throw or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

The grauladon can't use Noxious Breath or Reactive Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Noxious Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Graveshell.name: Graveshell
Graveshell.publicNotes:
The graveshell is a dangerous predator that draws scavengers and explorers into its grasp using a morbid lure: the corpse of a former victim impaled upon the spikes that protrude from its large, turtle-like shell. Aside from its shell, the monster resembles no known animal. Small but bright yellow eyes watch from the sagging flesh of its head, the most prominent feature of which is a curiously shaped, toothy maw twisted into a perpetual grin. Its stubby arms and legs are impractical for both walking and swimming, though the algae-caked claws tipping each limb are deadly weapons.

Graveshells are intelligent-a fact that surprises many who encounter them-and surrender rather than fight to the death. These monsters have little to offer in exchange for their lives, though the waterlogged treasures on their collection of corpses may entice opportunists.

shield->Shell.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ezVp13Uw8cWW08Da]
Shell
shield->Shell.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ezVp13Uw8cWW08Da]

A graveshell's shell has a Hardness of 6, 10 Hit Points, and a Broken Threshold of 5. If its shell is broken, the graveshell can't attack with shell spikes, nor can it use Shell Game. If the shell is destroyed, the graveshell's AC is reduced to 16. As long as a graveshell is alive, its shell naturally repairs itself after a week.

action->Corpse Disguise.name: Corpse Disguise
action->Corpse Disguise.description: The graveshell conceals its true nature over the course of a few minutes by impaling a corpse (typically humanoid) on its spiky shell before partially submerging itself in water. It has an automatic result of 22 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as a corpse floating in the water.

action->Wavesense (Imprecise) 30 feet.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.VdSMQ6yRZ3YXNXHL]
Wavesense (Imprecise) 30 feet

action->Shell Block.name: Shell Block
action->Shell Block.description:
Trigger The graveshell takes damage from a physical attack while withdrawn into its shell

Effect The graveshell reduces the damage from the attack by an amount equal to its shell's Hardness. A graveshell's shell has a Hardness of 6, 10 Hit Points, and a Broken Threshold of 5. If its shell is broken, the graveshell can't attack with shell spikes, nor can it use Shell Game. If the shell is destroyed, the graveshell's AC is reduced to 16. As long as a graveshell is alive, its shell naturally repairs itself after a week.

action->Deep Breath.name: Deep Breath
action->Deep Breath.description: The graveshell can hold its breath for 200 rounds (20 minutes).

action->Shell Game.name: Shell Game
action->Shell Game.description: The graveshell withdraws into its shell, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC and allowing it to use Shell Block. This lasts until the graveshell moves or attacks with any attack other than its shell spikes. The graveshell can't take this action or get any benefit from it if its shell is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6dNUvdb1dhToNDj3]{Broken}.

Grippli Archer.name: Arqueiro Grippli
Grippli Archer.publicNotes:
Humanoides semelhantes a sapos que fazem suas casas nas copas das árvores de florestas e selvas tropicais, os gripplis são excepcionalmente adaptados ao seu ambiente. Seus olhos grandes lhes dão uma visão aguçada tanto na luz quanto no escuro, e seus dedos grandes permitem que eles escalem facilmente as árvores sobre as quais residem. Os gripplis variam muito em aparência física, suas fisiologias em grande parte determinadas pelo ambiente ao seu redor; aqueles que vivem em florestas verdejantes, por exemplo, normalmente têm pele verde brilhante e olhos vermelhos. Em contraste, os gripplis que vivem em regiões de apodrecimento e decomposição têm coloração marrom mosqueada, e aqueles que vivem perto de lagos ou riachos podem ter listras azuis e laranja brilhantes. Gripplis típicos têm pouco mais de 60 centímetros de altura e pesam aproximadamente 15 kg.

De qualquer região de onde venham, os gripplis tendem a ser caçadores-coletores pacíficos. Devido à sua modesta compreensão da agricultura, os gripplis não cultivam plantações no sentido tradicional, embora cultivem manchas de cogumelos e coletem uma grande variedade de frutas da natureza ao redor. A selva também contém rios e lagos cheios de peixes de escamas prateadas, que os gripplis colhem de forma sustentável para garantir seu suprimento futuro, bem como insetos gordurosos que crescem muito mais do que em outras partes do mundo. Algumas das sociedades grippli mais avançadas capturam e criam esses insetos, nutrindo rebanhos de libélulas ou besouros gigantes que são eventualmente abatidos para alimentar o resto da aldeia. Gripplis particularmente empreendedores até procuram e domesticam enormes insetos voadores para usar como montarias durante suas caçadas. A criação de insetos tão grandes não é uma tarefa fácil, no entanto, então os gripplis que conseguem fazê-lo são frequentemente considerados heróis locais.

Os assentamentos nas copas das árvores dos gripplis são difíceis de avistar do solo da floresta. Os gripplis escondem suas posses com folhas largas e galhos grossos, e criam na floresta ao redor trilhas labirínticas que só eles sabem navegar. Suas aldeias são geralmente construídas entre as populações mais densas de árvores, com finas pontes de corda amarradas entre largas plataformas de madeira construídas ao redor de cada tronco.

Esses atiradores de elite são famosos por sua paciência e precisão.

action->Hail of Arrows.name: Chuva de Flechas
action->Hail of Arrows.description: O arqueiro grippli faz três Ataques à distância com seu arco curto, todos contra um único alvo. Combine o dano de quaisquer Ataques que acertem para fins de resistências e fraquezas.

action->Jungle Stride.name: Passo da Selva
action->Jungle Stride.description: Um grippli ignora terreno difícil em florestas e selvas.

Grippli Greenspeaker.name: Grippli Falante Verde
Grippli Greenspeaker.publicNotes:
Humanoides semelhantes a sapos que fazem suas casas nas copas das árvores de florestas e selvas tropicais, os gripplis são excepcionalmente adaptados ao seu ambiente. Seus olhos grandes lhes dão uma visão aguçada tanto na luz quanto no escuro, e seus dedos grandes permitem que eles escalem facilmente as árvores sobre as quais residem. Os gripplis variam muito em aparência física, suas fisiologias em grande parte determinadas pelo ambiente ao seu redor; aqueles que vivem em florestas verdejantes, por exemplo, normalmente têm pele verde brilhante e olhos vermelhos. Em contraste, os gripplis que vivem em regiões de apodrecimento e decomposição têm coloração marrom mosqueada, e aqueles que vivem perto de lagos ou riachos podem ter listras azuis e laranja brilhantes. Gripplis típicos têm pouco mais de 60 centímetros de altura e pesam aproximadamente 15 kg.

De qualquer região de onde venham, os gripplis tendem a ser caçadores-coletores pacíficos. Devido à sua modesta compreensão da agricultura, os gripplis não cultivam plantações no sentido tradicional, embora cultivem manchas de cogumelos e coletem uma grande variedade de frutas da natureza ao redor. A selva também contém rios e lagos cheios de peixes de escamas prateadas, que os gripplis colhem de forma sustentável para garantir seu suprimento futuro, bem como insetos gordurosos que crescem muito mais do que em outras partes do mundo. Algumas das sociedades grippli mais avançadas capturam e criam esses insetos, nutrindo rebanhos de libélulas ou besouros gigantes que são eventualmente abatidos para alimentar o resto da aldeia. Gripplis particularmente empreendedores até procuram e domesticam enormes insetos voadores para usar como montarias durante suas caçadas. A criação de insetos tão grandes não é uma tarefa fácil, no entanto, então os gripplis que conseguem fazê-lo são frequentemente considerados heróis locais.

Os assentamentos nas copas das árvores dos gripplis são difíceis de avistar do solo da floresta. Os gripplis escondem suas posses com folhas largas e galhos grossos, e criam na floresta ao redor trilhas labirínticas que só eles sabem navegar. Suas aldeias são geralmente construídas entre as populações mais densas de árvores, com finas pontes de corda amarradas entre largas plataformas de madeira construídas ao redor de cada tronco.

Os curandeiros não oficiais da espécie grippli são conhecidos como falantes verdes.

spell->Produce Flame.name: Produce Flame
spell->Produce Flame.description:
A small ball of flame appears in the palm of your hand, and you lash out with it either in melee or at range. Make a spell attack roll against your target's AC. This is normally a ranged attack, but you can also make a melee attack against a creature in your unarmed reach.

On a success, you deal 2d4 fire damage. On a critical success, the target takes double damage and @Damage[(@item.level)d4[persistent,fire]] damage.

Heightened (+1) Increase the damage by 1d4 and the persistent damage on a critical hit by 1d4.

Hellcrown.name: Hellcrown
Hellcrown.publicNotes:
The life of a Hellknight is bloody, brutal, and often short. Many who perish in service to a Hellknight order are glad to rest after having served their masters so faithfully, but others seek to continue their work even in death. When a Hellknight is decapitated, the ghostly undead known as a hellcrown is an occasional result. Consumed by the desire to bring about order by inflicting cruelty, hellcrowns haunt battlefields and abandoned castles, slaying all they encounter. A strange fusion of spirit and steel, a hellcrown has no corporeal form by itself, but instead inhabits the helmet it so proudly wore in life. Dangling from the helmet like a shroud is a shadow of the former Hellknight's spine, adding to the creature's terrifyingly gruesome appearance. Hellknights regard hellcrowns with a mixture of disgust and respect, considering the individuals who transform into these floating undead to have been resolute in purpose but weak in body.

A hellcrown usually manifests hours or longer after its body's death, and only when its body is unattended; this might even take days if the Hellknight perished in a major battle. Typically, no recognizable fragment of the Hellknight's former personality survives the grisly transformation into a hellcrown, but in rare and particularly tragic cases a hellcrown might remember its life and hold grudges against those it views as the cause of its death. Regardless of whether they retain memories of their lives or have lost all former sense of self, hellcrowns linger around the site of their death, reminding all they encounter of the merciless principles of their order.

action->Bleeding Nail.name: Bleeding Nail
action->Bleeding Nail.description: If the hellcrown hits with a nail Strike, the target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:16] save. On a failure, the nail is embedded in the creature, making it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute and giving it @Damage[1[bleed]] damage (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} and @Damage[1d4[bleed]] on a critical failure). Each additional embedded nail increases the enfeebled value by 1 (to a maximum of enfeebled 4) and the bleed damage by 1. A creature can remove a nail with an Interact action to reduce the enfeeblement and amount of bleed damage. Pulling out the last nail removes both conditions.

action->Terrifying Stare.name: Terrifying Stare
action->Terrifying Stare.description: All creatures that can see the hellcrown and are suffering from its bleeding nail must attempt a @Check[will|dc:16] saving throw. A creature that fails is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}, and on a critical failure becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for as long as it's frightened. Any creature that attempts a save is then temporarily immune for 10 minutes.

action->Grasping Hands.description: The mutant's various hands stretch and reach out in an attempt to grab nearby creatures. The mutant attempts an Athletics check to [[/act grapple]] all creatures within 10 feet. The mutant's multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until it has made all the Athletics checks that are part of its Grasping Hands. Creatures that are grabbed are pulled to a space adjacent to the mutant. This is forced movement.

tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.6nrCxNQFycUVFOV2]

You need thieves' tools to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2EE4aF4SZpYf0R6H]{Pick Locks} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]{Disable Devices} (of some types) using the Thievery skill. Infiltrator thieves' tools add a +1 item bonus to checks to Pick Locks and Disable Devices.

If your thieves' tools are broken, you can repair them by replacing the lock picks with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.BznmPaRjI4Orb0IH]{Replacement Picks} appropriate to your tools; this doesn't require using the Repair action. If you wear your thieves' tools, you can draw and replace them as part of the action that uses them.

action->Timely Distraction.name: Distração Oportuna
action->Timely Distraction.description:
Gatilho Uma criatura que Heuberk pode ver dentro de seu alcance corpo a corpo erra um Strike corpo a corpo contra ele.

Efeito Heuberk tenta @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Fingir} contra a criatura. Se não for o turno de Heuberk e ele obtiver sucesso, o efeito se aplica em seu próximo turno.

action->Identify an Opening.name: Identificar uma Abertura
action->Identify an Opening.description:
Requisitos Uma criatura está @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenida} contra o próximo ataque corpo a corpo de Heuberk.

Efeito Heuberk aponta uma falha nas defesas da criatura. A criatura fica desprevenida contra todos os ataques corpo a corpo tentados por quaisquer aliados de Heuberk que ouçam e entendam esta instrução até o início do próximo turno de Heuberk.

action->Kobold Explosives.name: Kobold Explosives
action->Kobold Explosives.description:
Cost 1 batch of infused reagents.

Effect Hezle quickly cobbles together an explosive bomb and lobs it up to 30 feet. All creatures in a @Template[burst|distance:5] take @Damage[5d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic|traits:interact] save).

action->Smoky Retreat.name: Smoky Retreat
action->Smoky Retreat.description:
Cost 1 batch of infused reagents.

Requirements Hezle must be adjacent to at least one enemy.

Effect Hezle throws a mix of special powders centered on a corner of her space, creating a plume of smoke filling a @Template[burst|distance:5] until the end of her turn that causes her to be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}. She then immediately @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneaks}, but must end her movement in a space that's not adjacent to any enemies.

All creatures other than Hezle in the smoke cloud must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:26] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

She still must expend charges from the staff normally; when she prepares the staff each morning, she is capable of placing 4 charges in the staff.

action->Efficient Capture.name: Efficient Capture
action->Efficient Capture.description:
Requirements Ilssrah has manacles in hand and is adjacent to a creature.

Effect Ilssrah attempts to bind the creature's wrists or ankles with the manacles. If she succeeds at an attack roll with a [[/r 1d20+30 #attack]]{+30} modifier against the target's AC, she applies the manacles.

action->Hammer the Chained.name: Hammer the Chained
action->Hammer the Chained.description:
Ilssrah attempts a melee Strike with Fleshroaster. If she hits, she also draws her light hammer, makes a melee Strike with it against the same target, and immediately returns it to her belt. She then resumes her grip on Fleshroaster. Both Strikes count toward Ilssrah's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until both Strikes have been made. If the hammer Strike hits, it deals damage as normal and the target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:35] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is clumsy 1 and stupefied 1 for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 minute.

Immortal Ichor.name: Immortal Ichor
Immortal Ichor.publicNotes: An immortal ichor is an intelligent mass of blood from a dead evil deity. The cultists who perform the ritual to create immortal ichor typically seal up the sentient ooze in an underground or remote chamber that blocks its magical abilities, but over time these seals break or weaken, freeing the unholy monster.

action->Immortality.name: Immortality
action->Immortality.description: The immortal ichor doesn't age, nor does it need to eat or breathe. It can die only as a result of violence.

action->Corrupt Ally.name: Corrupt Ally
action->Corrupt Ally.description: A creature that fails to save against an immortal ichor's charm spell becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1}. The stupefied value reduces by 1 every 24 hours. The first time each day a creature stupefied by the ichor's charm fails to save against another casting of the ichor's charm, the value of the condition increases by [[/r 1d4]]. If the stupefied condition ever equals the creature's Wisdom score, it becomes controlled by the ichor permanently; if it dies, it rises the next round as a zombie (of the GM's choice) under the ichor's control. If the ichor is killed, these zombies are destroyed.

action->Dead Spells.name: Dead Spells
action->Dead Spells.description: An immortal ichor can cast an initial and advanced domain spell of a domain that belonged to the dead deity from which the ichor arose (the domain spells presented here are from the destruction domain).

action->Mental Erosion.name: Mental Erosion
action->Mental Erosion.description: A creature hit by the ichor's pseudopod is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 day unless it succeeds at a @Check[will|dc:35] save.

action->Resanguinate.name: Resanguinate
action->Resanguinate.description: The immortal ichor draws blood from the pores of living creatures around it. Any living creature within 30 feet that has blood takes [[/r {4d6}]]{4d6 damage} (@Check[fortitude|dc:33|basic] save). The immortal ichor regains HP equal to the total damage dealt. A creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} on a critical failure).

tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.qCEOZ6109Yo34tRx]

Contains formulas for all common alchemical items of 19th level or lower.

A formula book holds the formulas necessary to make items other than the common equipment from this chapter; alchemists typically get one for free. Each formula book can hold the formulas for up to 100 different items. Formulas can also appear on parchment sheets, tablets, and almost any other medium; there's no need for you to copy them into a specific book as long as you can keep them on hand to reference them.

tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.nS75vsM3x5jxlUqn]

Activate 1 Interact

Your features transform into something bestial and you take on muscle mass, but your lumbering form is clumsy.

Benefit You gain a +4 item bonus to Athletics checks and unarmed attack rolls. You gain a claw unarmed attack (@Damage[1d8[slashing]] damage) with the agile trait and a jaws unarmed attack (@Damage[1d10[piercing]] damage). You gain the weapon specialization with the claws and jaws, or greater weapon specialization, if you already have weapon specialization with these unarmed attacks.

Drawback You take a -1 penalty to AC and a -2 penalty to Reflex saves.

Duration 1 hour.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.1ouUo8lLK6H79Rqh]{Effect: Bestial Mutagen (Major)}

consumable->Juggernaut Mutagen (Major) [.name:

tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.1kNp6yOS0aZPBPzZ]

Activate A Interact

After you drink this mutagen, your body becomes thick and sturdy. You exhibit a healthy glow, though you tend to be ponderous and unobservant.

Benefit You gain a +4 item bonus to Fortitude saves and 45 temporary Hit Points. Whenever you are at maximum Hit Points for at least 1 full minute, you regain the temporary Hit Points. When you roll a success on a Fortitude save you get a critical success instead, and you critical failures on Fortitude saves become failures instead.

Drawback You take a -2 penalty to Will saves, Perception checks and initiative rolls.

Duration 1 hour.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.2PNo8u4wxSbz5WEs]{Effect: Juggernaut Mutagen (Major)}

These items last for 24 hours or until the next time he makes his daily preparations.

action->Inject Unstable Mutagen.name: Inject Unstable Mutagen
action->Inject Unstable Mutagen.description:
Trigger Ingnovim damages a creature with a syringe Strike

Effect The creature injected with unstable mutagen must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:41] save to resist the injection.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Failure The target's body shifts and mutates, growing difficult to control; the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 24 hours.

Critical Failure The target's body completely distorts into a shuddering blob of warped flesh that is incapable of action; the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. Every 24 hours, the target may attempt a new saving throw against this effect; on a critical success, the paralysis ends.

action->Mutagenic Adaptation.name: Mutagenic Adaptation
action->Mutagenic Adaptation.description: Ingnovim's body has adapted to the constant use of his mutagens. He does not suffer the drawback of any bestial mutagens but is still affected normally by other mutagens.

action->Quick Bomber.name: Quick Bomber
action->Quick Bomber.description: Ingnovim draws an alchemical bomb with an Interact action and throws it as a ranged Strike.

weapon->Longsword.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.LJdbVTOZog39EEbi]

Longswords can be one-edged or two-edged swords. Their blades are heavy and they're between 3 and 4 feet in length.

action->Death Throes.name: Death Throes
action->Death Throes.description:
When one of Ingnovim's assistants dies, it bursts open in a foul-sounding and smelling explosion of toxic viscera and poisonous vapors. All creatures within a @Template[burst|distance:20] must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:38] save to resist this blast of poison.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[7d8[poison]] damage.

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[14d8[poison],2d8[persistent,poison]]{14d8 poison damage and 2d8 persistent poison damage}.

tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.hFtNbo1LKYCoDy2O]

Inizra can use Attack of Opportunity when a creature within her reach uses a concentrate action, in addition to its normal trigger. She can disrupt triggering concentrate actions, and she disrupts actions on any hit, not just a critical hit.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.AttackOfOpportunity]

action->Boundless Reprisals.name: Boundless Reprisals
action->Boundless Reprisals.description: Inizra gains a reaction at the start of each enemy's turn that she can use only during that turn.

action->Mirror Shield.name: Mirror Shield
action->Mirror Shield.description:
Requirements You have a shield raised.

Trigger An opponent casting a spell that targets you critically fails a spell attack roll against your AC.

Effect You reflect the spell back against the triggering opponent. Make a ranged attack against the triggering creature using your highest proficiency with a ranged weapon. If you can cast spells, you can make a spell attack roll instead. If you succeed, your opponent takes the effects of a successful spell attack roll for their own spell (or the effects of a critical success if your attack roll was a critical success).

action->Paragon's Guard Stance.name: Paragon's Guard Stance
action->Paragon's Guard Stance.description: Inizra always has her shield raised as if she had used the Raise a Shield action, as long as she meets that action's requirements.

action->Weapon Supremacy.name: Weapon Supremacy
action->Weapon Supremacy.description: Inizra is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened 1}. She can use her extra action only to Strike.

tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.dRi775Uhzqgn7aBs]

This potent poison consists of crystals whose flavor and appearance mimics edible salt but whose effects are deadly: victims experience periods of waking nightmares that overload the senses and eventually result in death through a combination of shock and exhaustion.

Activate 3 Interact (Ingested)

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:43]

Onset 1 hour

Maximum Duration 5 days

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} once every [[/r 1d4]] hours, plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 minute once every [[/r 1d4]] hours, plus frightened 3 and fatigued (1 day)

Stage 3 frightened 3, plus confused for [[/r 1d4]] minutes, once every hour, plus fatigued (1 day)

Stage 4 death

tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.5hGJ6CZi0A9OjMd4]

Created from a daemon's powdered soul gems or refined from the waters of Abaddon's rivers, oblivion essence causes victims to rapidly age and decay.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:42]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[8d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[10d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}, and slowed 1 (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[12d6[poison]] damage, enfeebled 3, slowed 1 (1 round)

action->Change Shape.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.eQM5hQ1W3d1uen97]

Ishti can take on the appearance of a Medium humanoid. This doesn't change her Speed or her attack and damage modifiers with her Strikes, but it does prevent them from using her cursed touch. Ishti has a fixed humanoid form-they cannot adopt a different appearance each time they use this ability, and the appearance resembles that of their upper torso when in their true form.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

action->Matriarch's Caress.name: Matriarch's Caress
action->Matriarch's Caress.description:
Ishti touches a creature, who must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:40] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} if it critically fails).

If the target fails additional saves against this ability, the condition value increases by 1 (or 2 if it critically fails) (to a maximum of stupefied 4). This condition value decreases by 1 every 24 hours.

action->Poison Weapon.name: Poison Weapon
action->Poison Weapon.description: Ishti applies a poison to a piercing or slashing weapon of her choice.

action->Quick Dervish Strike.name: Quick Dervish Strike
action->Quick Dervish Strike.description: Ishti makes a dagger attack against each enemy within reach. Each attack counts toward her multiple attack penalty, but the penalty does not increase until after all the attacks. The first enemy she damages is subject to matriarch's caress.

When a lich is destroyed, its soul immediately transfers to its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.NEbr7nKuiluJgBHT]{Soul Cage}. A lich can be permanently destroyed only if its soul cage is found and destroyed.

action->Bones of Stone.name: Ossos de Pedra
action->Bones of Stone.description:
Requisitos O alvo está em pé ou adjacente a uma superfície de pedra.

Frequência uma vez por rodada

Efeito Jaggaki invoca espíritos inquietos dentro da terra, fazendo com que um braço esquelético gigante feito de pedra irregular alcance uma superfície de pedra adjacente a uma criatura a até 18 metros. Jaggaki faz um Strike com a mão contra o alvo através deste braço de pedra em vez de usar sua própria mão. Se o Strike acertar, causa @Damage[4d6[bludgeoning]] de dano.

action->Drain Soul Cage.name:

Effect Jaggaki taps into his @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.NEbr7nKuiluJgBHT]{Soul Cage's} power to cast any arcane spell up to the highest level he can cast, even if the spell being cast is not one of the lich's prepared spells.

Jaggaki's soul cage doesn't need to be present for him to use this ability.

A creature damaged by the Jaggaki's hand Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:29] save.

The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round on a failure. On a critical failure, the creature is paralyzed permanently, falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, and seems dead. A @Check[medicine|dc:25|name:Diagnose Paralysis] check reveals the victim is alive.

action->Steady Spellcasting.name: Conjuração Constante
action->Steady Spellcasting.description: Se a reação de outra criatura interromperia a ação de conjuração de Jaggaki, Jaggaki tenta um teste @Check[flat|dc:15]. Se ele obtiver sucesso, sua ação não é interrompida.

spell->Litany against Wrath.name: Litany against Wrath
spell->Litany against Wrath.description:
Your litany rails against the sin of wrath, punishing the target for attacking good creatures. The target must attempt a Will save. A particularly wrathful creature, such as a wrath demon, uses the outcome one degree of success worse than the result of its saving throw. The target then becomes temporarily immune to all of your litanies for 1 minute.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The first time the target uses an action that deals damage to at least one good creature, the target takes 3d6 spirit damage.

Failure Each time the target uses an action that deals damage to at least one good creature, the target takes 3d6 spirit damage.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}. Each time it uses an action that deals damage to at least one good creature, the target takes 3d6 spirit damage.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.

spell->Dancing Lights.name: Dancing Lights
spell->Dancing Lights.description: You create up to four floating lights, no two of which are more than 10 feet apart. Each sheds light like a torch. When you Sustain the Spell, you can move any number of lights up to 60 feet. Each light must remain within 120 feet of you and within 10 feet of all others, or it winks out.

action->Glimpse of Redemption.name: Glimpse of Redemption
action->Glimpse of Redemption.description:
Trigger An enemy damages one of Jahsi's allies within 15 feet of him.

Effect The foe must choose one: The ally is unharmed by the triggering damage, or the ally gains resistance 10 against the triggering damage, and the enemy is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} until the end of its next turn.

Kalavakus.name: Kalavakus
Kalavakus.publicNotes: Kalavakus trabalham como escravizadores no Abismo, ganhando o apelido alternativo de "demônios escravizadores"; esses demônios reúnem vítimas capturadas e as vendem para outros demônios ou mortais inescrupulosos. Pedidos de liberdade ou clemência caem em ouvidos surdos, pois demônios escravizadores consideram qualquer um que possam capturar e manter como sua propriedade legítima e deles para vender. Kalavakus conhecem mais do que apenas meios físicos de restringir escravos; eles também sabem como acorrentar a alma de uma vítima. Os demônios escravizadores mais bem-sucedidos têm vastos poços de escravos no Abismo, onde mantêm estábulos de almas aprisionadas.
Kalavakus.saveDetails: +1 de status em todos os salvamentos contra magia

action->Horn Snare.name: Laço de Chifre
action->Horn Snare.description:
Gatilho Uma criatura erra o demônio escravizador com um Strike de arma corpo a corpo.

Efeito O demônio escravizador tenta @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Desarmar} a arma usada no Strike que acionou o efeito com uma penalidade de -2. Se ele rolar um sucesso, ele obtém um sucesso crítico em vez disso. O demônio não precisa de uma mão livre para usar esta habilidade.

action->Liberation Vulnerability.name: Vulnerabilidade à Libertação
action->Liberation Vulnerability.description: Na primeira vez em cada rodada que uma criatura escapa do Enslaved Soul do demônio escravizador ou o demônio escravizador testemunha uma criatura sendo libertada do cativeiro ou da escravidão mental, o demônio sofre @Damage[3d6[mental]] de dano.

action->Enslave Soul.name: Escravizar Alma
action->Enslave Soul.description:
O demônio escraviza a alma de uma criatura viva a até 18 metros. O alvo pode tentar resistir a essa escravidão com um salvamento de @Check[will|dc:29].

Um demônio escravizador só pode ter uma alma viva escravizada com esta habilidade por vez, e não mais de um demônio escravizador pode escravizar a mesma alma. Se um demônio escravizador matar uma criatura cuja alma ele escravizou, o demônio recupera @Damage[20[healing]] PV e a alma é consignada a uma eternidade de trabalho no Abismo, adicionando à contagem de almas do demônio escravizador e permitindo que o demônio escravize outra.

Sucesso O alvo evita ser escravizado e fica temporariamente imune por 24 horas.

Falha O alvo é escravizado e fica @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfraquecido 2} por 24 horas ou até que o demônio escravizador seja morto, o que ocorrer primeiro.

Falha Crítica Como na falha, e o alvo também sofre os efeitos de uma falha no teste de resistência contra @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominar}.

Kelda Halrig.source: Pathfinder #148: Fires of the Haunted City

tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.0QgniSjpzksm5riV]

You need these tools to create items from raw materials with the Craft skill. Sterling artisan's tools give you a +1 item bonus to the check.

Different sets are needed for different work, as determined by the GM; for example, blacksmith's tools differ from woodworker's tools.

action->Master Smith.name: Master Smith
action->Master Smith.description: As the most skillful blacksmith in Kovlar, Kelda's abilities far surpass those of typical smiths. She can Craft items as if she were 16th level. Additionally, she knows how to make a vast catalog of items, including numerous uncommon formulas and several rare formulas. The exact formulas she knows can be tailored to fit the needs of each particular group of PCs, but most are for weapons, armor, and other items that could reasonably be made in a forge.

If all of Saggorak's buildings are destroyed, or if heroes perform a great service in saving Saggorak, King Harral loses this ability.

action->Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
action->Steady Spellcasting.description: If another creature's reaction would disrupt King Harral's spell, he attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15]. If he succeeds, the spell isn't disrupted.

Scroll of Discern Location (Level 8)
consumable->Scroll of Discern Location (.consumableSpellDescription: You learn the name of the target's exact location (including the building, community, and country) and plane of existence. You can target a creature only if you've seen it in person, have one of its significant belongings, or have a piece of its body. To target an object, you must have touched it or have a fragment of it. Discern location automatically overcomes protections against detection and divination of lower level than this spell, even if they would normally have a chance to block it.
consumable->Scroll of Discern Location (.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.iPki3yuoucnj7bIt]

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.CeSh8QcVnqP5OlLj]{Pinpoint}

Casting a Spell from a scroll requires holding the scroll in one hand and activating it with a Cast a Spell activity using the normal number of actions for that spell.

To Cast a Spell from a scroll, the spell must appear on your spell list. Because you're the one Casting the Spell, use your spell attack roll and spell DC. The spell also gains the appropriate trait for your tradition (arcane, divine, occult, or primal).

Any physical material components and costs are provided when a scroll is created, so you don't need to provide them when Casting a Spell from a scroll. You must replace any required material component for that spell with a somatic component. If the spell requires a focus, you must have that focus to Cast the Spell from a scroll.

Note: To create a scroll or wand of a specific spell, drag the spell from the compendium or compendium browser into the inventory of a PC, NPC, or loot actor.

action->Intimidating Attack of Opportuni.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.hFtNbo1LKYCoDy2O]

tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.hFtNbo1LKYCoDy2O]

Kralgurn's Attacks of Opportunity not only wound creatures, but also shatter their confidence. If Kralgurn hits and deals damage with an Attack of Opportunity, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 4} on a critical hit.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.AttackOfOpportunity]

action->Fearsome Brute.name: Fearsome Brute
action->Fearsome Brute.description: When Kralgurn attacks a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} creature, he gains a circumstance bonus to damage equal to three times the target's frightened value.

action->Attack of Opportunity (Special).name:

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.AttackOfOpportunity]

action->Archery Experience.name: Experiência em Arquearia
action->Archery Experience.description: Laslunn não sofre a penalidade da característica descarga, e seus Strikes à distância não acionam reações.

action->Bark Orders.name: Ordens Ríspidas
action->Bark Orders.description: Laslunn emite um comando para reposicionar seus aliados. Aliados que ouvem e entendem esta ordem podem usar uma reação para Dar um Passo.

action->Efficient Capture.name: Captura Eficiente
action->Efficient Capture.description:
Requisitos Laslunn tem algemas na mão e está adjacente a uma criatura.

Efeito Laslunn tenta prender os pulsos ou tornozelos da criatura com as algemas. Se ela obtiver sucesso em uma rolagem de ataque com um modificador de [[/r 1d20+28 #Manacles]]{+28} contra a CA do alvo, ela aplica as algemas aos pulsos ou pernas da criatura.

action->Rugged Travel.name: Viagem Áspera
action->Rugged Travel.description: Laslunn ignora o primeiro quadrado de terreno difícil em que se move cada vez que Dá um Passo ou se Desloca.

action->Superior Pack Attack.name: Ataque de Alcateia Superior
action->Superior Pack Attack.description: Laslunn causa 2d8 de dano extra a qualquer criatura que esteja ao alcance de pelo menos um de seus aliados.

action->Twin Shot.name: Tiro Duplo
action->Twin Shot.description: Laslunn faz dois Strikes com seu arco usando sua penalidade de ataque múltiplo atual. Se ambos os ataques atingirem a mesma criatura, combine o dano e aplique resistências e fraquezas apenas uma vez. Isso conta como dois ataques ao calcular a penalidade de ataque múltiplo de Laslunn.

Lazurite-Infused Stone Golem.name: Lazurite-Infused Stone Golem
Lazurite-Infused Stone Golem.source: Pathfinder #148: Fires of the Haunted City

action->Golem Antimagic.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.r34QDwKiWZoVymJa]

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.GolemAntimagic]

action->Necrotic Field.name: Necrotic Field
action->Necrotic Field.description:
30 feet. Vitality energy effects within the golem's necrotic field deal only half their normal damage. Additionally, all undead within its aura deal an additional @Damage[1d6[void]] damage with their natural attacks.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.kjP0J97hhoIhbF3M]{Effect: Necrotic Field}

action->Vulnerable to Stone to Flesh.name: Vulnerable to Stone to Flesh
action->Vulnerable to Stone to Flesh.description: A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Pr1ruNTbzGn3H9w5]{Stone to Flesh} spell negates the golem's antimagic and its resistance to physical damage for 1 round. A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.znv4ECL7ZtuiagtA]{Petrify} spell reverses this effect immediately.

action->Inexorable March.name: Inexorable March
action->Inexorable March.description: The golem Strides up to its Speed, pushing back each creature whose space it moves into and damaging them if they try to stop its movement. A creature can bar the way by succeeding at a @Check[fortitude|dc:36] save. On a critical success, the resisting creature takes no damage; otherwise, it takes damage equal to that dealt by the golem's fist Strike

action->Necrotic Affliction.name: Necrotic Affliction
action->Necrotic Affliction.description:
Trigger The golem hits a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed} creature.

Effect The creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:34] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} on a critical failure) as the golem's lazurite leeches vital energies and causes wounds to rot.

action->Necrotic Pulse.name: Necrotic Pulse
action->Necrotic Pulse.description: Each creature in a @Template[emanation|distance:10] must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:32] save or take @Damage[1d6[persistent,void]] damage and be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 minute as their flesh and bones temporarily atrophy. The golem can't use Necrotic Pulse again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Necrotic Pulse]]{1d4 rounds}.

Lesser Dragonstorm.name: Lesser Dragonstorm
Lesser Dragonstorm.description: A small-scale version of a dragonstorm-a churning vortex of wind infused with fire, acid, lightning, poison, and ice-fills Alseta's Ring.
Lesser Dragonstorm.disable: @Check[religion|dc:40|name:Call for Divine Intervention] (legendary) to call out to a non-evil deity for direct intervention to disperse the lesser dragonstorm (prayers to Apsu allow characters who are masters in Religion to attempt the check as if they were legendary instead), @Check[thievery|dc:42|name:Deactivate Vengegate|traits:action:disable-a-device] (legendary) to deactivate Vengegate while the manifestation is forcing it open, or a successful @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (10th rank; DC 40) to counteract the lesser dragonstorm.
Lesser Dragonstorm.routine: (1 action) On its initiative, the lesser dragonstorm reaches out and blasts all creatures within Alseta's Ring. Affected creatures take @Damage[2d8[acid],2d8[cold],2d8[electricity],2d8[fire],2d8[poison]]{10d8 damage} (@Check[reflex|dc:46|basic]), evenly split between acid, cold, fire, electricity, and poison. Creatures that fail their save are pulled 20 feet toward the center of Alseta's Ring (or are knocked prone and pulled 30 feet on a critical failure). After 10 rounds, the lesser dragonstorm is destroyed, but a much greater dragonstorm manifests in the surrounding region-see The Dragonstorm.

action->Manifest Lesser Dragonstorm.name: Manifest Lesser Dragonstorm
action->Manifest Lesser Dragonstorm.description:
Trigger A creature attempts to activate Vengegate

Effect The chamber within Alseta's Ring fills with a dragonstorm. Creatures within this area take @Damage[2d8[acid],2d8[cold],2d8[electricity],2d8[fire],2d8[poison]]{10d8 damage}, equally split between acid, cold, electricity, fire, and poison.

Lesser Manifestation Of Dahak.name: Lesser Manifestation Of Dahak
Lesser Manifestation Of Dahak.saveDetails: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

action->Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
action->Smoke Vision.description: Smoke doesn't impair a red dragon's vision; it ignores the concealed condition from smoke.

action->Redirect Energy.name: Redirect Energy
action->Redirect Energy.description:
Trigger A creature within 100 feet casts an acid, cold, fire, electricity, or poison spell, or such a spell otherwise comes into effect from a source within 100 feet

Effect The manifestation of Dahak makes all the choices to determine the targets, destination, or other effects of the spell, as though it were the caster.

action->Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
action->Breath Weapon.description:
The manifestation of Dahak breathes a blast of dragonstorm energy that deals @Damage[5d6[acid],5d6[cold],5d6[electricity],5d6[fire],5d6[poison]|options:area-damage]{5d6 acid, 5d6 cold, 5d6 electricity, 5d6 fire, and 5d6 poison damage} in a @Template[cone|distance:60] (@Check[reflex|dc:46|basic|name:Dragonstorm Breath|traits:fire,acid,cold,electricity,poison|options:area-effect] save).

It can't use Dragonstorm Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Dragonstorm Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
action->Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one wing Strike in any order.

action->Draconic Momentum.name: Draconic Momentum
action->Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges its Breath Weapon whenever it scores a critical hit with a Strike.

action->Manipulate Energy.name: Manipulate Energy
action->Manipulate Energy.description: The manifestation attempts to take control of a magical acid, cold, electricity, fire, or poison spell within 100 feet. If it succeeds at a counteract check (counteract rank 10, counteract modifier [[/r 1d20+36 #Manipulate Energy]]{+36}), the original caster loses control of the spell, control is transferred to the manifestation, and the manifestation counts as having Sustained the Spell with this action (if applicable). The manifestation can end the spell instead of taking control, if it chooses.

Lifeleech Crystal Patches.name: Lifeleech Crystal Patches
Lifeleech Crystal Patches.description: Sharp, bloodthirsty crystals make walking through this chamber treacherous.
Lifeleech Crystal Patches.disable: @Check[religion|dc:30|name:Lifeleech Crystal Patch Disable|traits:environmental,magical] (expert) to utter prayers that quell the crystals' necromantic compulsion to drink blood
Lifeleech Crystal Patches.source: Pathfinder #148: Fires of the Haunted City
Lifeleech Crystal Patches.stealth: (expert) or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gpzpAAAJ1Lza2JVl]{Detect Magic} to note the presence of necromantic energies suffusing the crystals.

action->Slice Legs.name: Slice Legs
action->Slice Legs.description:
Trigger A creature with blood moves through a patch of lifeleech crystals.

Effect The crystals twist and slash, animating and cutting into the creature as it walks, dealing @Damage[5d8[slashing]] damage. The creature must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:28|traits:damaging-effect,environmental,magical] saving throw.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

Failure The creature takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2}.

Critical Failure As failure, plus the creature's blood causes fresh growth. A new 10-foot-square patch of lifeleech crystals grows in an adjacent space to the current patch of crystals.

Living Sap.name: Living Sap
Living Sap.publicNotes:
The tall sharinga trees of the Mwangi Expanse leak golden sap from their swollen, bulbous trunks, which coagulates when exposed to air. The toxic resin, which has a bitter taste, protects the tree from herbivorous insects and other animals, but in rare cases-usually in areas awash in vitality energy or the influence of the First World-the sap gains a life of its own. Such "living sap" is a mindless ooze that attempts to smother and engulf just about anything that moves, from the bugs and small beasts that feed on its sharinga tree to larger creatures unlucky enough to stumble upon it. Due to its immunities to most forms of physical damage and its protectiveness of its mother tree, a living ooze is a nuisance to communities that rely on the sap of sharinga trees to make resin, rubber, and glue.

Jungle-dwelling alchemists such as gripplis cherish the sap of the sharinga tree for its unique adhesive properties. The sap has been used for centuries to create tanglefoot bags, glue, and hard resin. Residue collected from a living sap is even more fascinating from an alchemical standpoint. Though harvesting a living sap is very dangerous, some alchemists will risk death in order to procure these easily worked ingredients. To increase the odds of a successful harvest, such employers are often willing to supply offensive aids such as lesser frost vials; living sap hunters learned long ago that cold energy is effective against these creatures and luckily doesn't harm the harvestable reagents.

action->Motion Sense 60 feet.name: Motion Sense 60 feet
action->Motion Sense 60 feet.description: Living sap can sense nearby motion through vibration and air movement.

action->Adhesive Body.name: Adhesive Body
action->Adhesive Body.description: A creature that Strikes a living sap with a melee weapon must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:24] save or be disarmed of that weapon. If the creature critically fails, the weapon ends up in the living sap's space. A creature that hits a living sap with an unarmed attack must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:24] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the living sap until the end of its next turn.

Sometimes called a hauberk, this is a long shirt constructed of the same metal rings as chainmail. However, it is much lighter than chainmail and protects only the torso, upper arms, and upper legs of its wearer.

equipment->Hunter's Arrowhead.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.JCGsj7iY88o9uTP5]

This arrowhead-shaped charm is not meant to be affixed to an arrow, but instead to be carried in a pocket or inside of a quiver. A hunter's arrowhead is etched with images sacred to the elven god Ketephys.

If you carry one on your person, you are infused with great skill at hunting, and gain a +1 item bonus to Survival skill checks and attack rolls against any creature you've currently designated as your prey for the Hunt Prey ranger ability (note that the bonus to attack rolls is an item bonus, and therefore not cumulative with an item bonus from a magic weapon).

A hunter's arrowhead is also a religious symbol of Ketephys.

Activate R command

Frequency once per day

Trigger You would miss with an attack made with a bow.

Effect You get a +2 circumstance bonus to your attack roll. This can turn a miss into a hit.

This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.

action->Channel Smite.name: Channel Smite
action->Channel Smite.description:
Cost Expend a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]{Harm} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal} spell.

Malarunk siphon's the destructive energies of vitality or void energy through a melee attack and into his foe.

Make a melee Strike and add the spell's damage to the Strike's damage.

This is void damage if Malarunk expended a harm spell or vitality damage if he expended a heal spell. The spell is expended with no effect if his Strike fails or hits a creature that isn't damaged by that energy type (such as if he hit a non-undead creature with a heal spell).

action->Shrieking Frenzy.name: Shrieking Frenzy
action->Shrieking Frenzy.description:
Trigger Malarunk's turn begins.

Frequency once per hour

Effect Malarunk is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} until the end of his turn, and can use the extra action to Stride or Strike. Due to his loud wailing while in a shrieking frenzy, Malarunk can't speak and automatically critically fails all Stealth checks.

action->Thrown Weapon Mastery.name: Thrown Weapon Mastery
action->Thrown Weapon Mastery.description: When Malarunk throws a weapon, the weapon gains the deadly d6 weapon trait. Furthermore, when Malarunk throws an improvised weapon, it doesn't take the -2 penalty for using an improvised weapon, nor does he take the penalty for using that weapon to make a lethal attack instead of a nonlethal attack.

spell->Wish.name: Wish
spell->Wish.description:
You state a wish, making your greatest desire come true. A wish spell can produce any one of the following effects.

  • Duplicate any spell from the arcane list of 9th rank or lower to which you have access.
  • Duplicate any spell from another spell list of 7th level or lower. It must be common or you must have access.
  • Produce any effect whose power level is in line with the above effects.
  • Reverse certain effects that refer to the wish spell.

The GM might allow you to try using wish to produce greater effects than these, but doing so might be dangerous or the spell might have only a partial effect.

Mengkare can't use this ability again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Golden Luck]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
action->Breath Weapon.description:
Mengkare breathes in one of two ways. He can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

  • Flame (arcane,evocation,fire); Mengkare breathes a blast of flame in a @Template[cone|distance:80] that deals @Damage[24d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:46|basic|name:Breath Weapon (Flame)] save).
  • Weakening Gas (arcane,necromancy); The dragon breathes a blast of weakening gas. Each creature within a @Template[cone|distance:30] must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:46|name:Breath Weapon (Weakening Gas)] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 4} for 1 minute (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 5} on a critical failure).

Mengkare assumes a Medium humanoid form, posing as the human wizard Lamond Breachton.

The dragon takes on the appearance of any Small or Medium humanoid. This doesn't change its Speed or attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes, but might change the damage type its Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

Creatures that critically fail their save catch on fire and take @Damage[4d6[persistent,fire]] damage.

Mental Scream Trap.description: A psychic scream disorients creatures in the area.
Mental Scream Trap.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:41|name:Suppress the Magic|traits:magical,trap] to suppress the magic or @Check[thievery|dc:41|name:Scratch Out the Ward|traits:magical,trap] to scratch out the ward

action->Psychic Screech.name: Psychic Screech
action->Psychic Screech.description:
Trigger A creature enters the marked area

Effect A psychic wail affects all creatures within 10 feet of the marked area, requiring them to attempt a @Check[will|dc:41] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round, then stunned 2 when the paralysis ends.

Critical Failure The target is paralyzed for 4 rounds. At the end of each of its turns, it can attempt a new Will save to reduce the remaining duration by 1 round, or end it entirely on a critical success.

action->Mobility.name: Mobilidade

equipment->Thieves' Tools (Infiltrator).description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.6nrCxNQFycUVFOV2]

You need thieves' tools to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2EE4aF4SZpYf0R6H]{Pick Locks} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]{Disable Devices} (of some types) using the Thievery skill. Infiltrator thieves' tools add a +1 item bonus to checks to Pick Locks and Disable Devices.

If your thieves' tools are broken, you can repair them by replacing the lock picks with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.BznmPaRjI4Orb0IH]{Replacement Picks} appropriate to your tools; this doesn't require using the Repair action. If you wear your thieves' tools, you can draw and replace them as part of the action that uses them.

action->Deny Advantage.description: Mialari não está @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenida} contra criaturas flanqueadoras de 10º nível ou inferior, ou criaturas de 10º nível ou inferior usando ataque surpresa.

action->Nimble Dodge.name: Esquiva Ágil
action->Nimble Dodge.description:

Efeito Mialari ganha um bônus de circunstância de +2 na CA contra o ataque que acionou o efeito.

action->Ranged Legerdemain.name: Leveza de Mãos à Distância
action->Ranged Legerdemain.description: Mialari pode usar telecinese para realizar ações de manipular que usam a perícia Ladinagem a um alcance de 9 metros, mas ela sofre uma penalidade de circunstância de -2 em seu teste ao fazê-lo.

action->Unbalancing Blow.name: Golpe Desequilibrante

action->Arborean Arm.name: Arborean Arm
action->Arborean Arm.description: This magical limb functions in all ways as Nketiah's original arm. The arm can extend a vine to attack in melee, and using the arm, Nketiah has a climb Speed of 20 feet and Climbs as if she had master proficiency in Athletics. Finally, the arm's primal magic allows her to use the spells from her verdant staff as if she had all of those spells on her spell list.

action->Woodland Elf.name: Woodland Elf
action->Woodland Elf.description: Nketiah can move at half her Speed on a successful Climb check and at full Speed on a critical success. She can always @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ust1jJSCZQUhBZIz]{Take Cover} within forest terrain to gain cover, even if she's not next to a wall or obstacle.

If you wear your thieves' tools, you can draw and replace them as part of the action that uses them.

Gatilho Nolly falha em um teste de perícia ou em um teste de resistência.

action->Inspiring Presence.description:
9 metros. Aliados a até 9 metros de Nolly ganham um bônus de circunstância de +2 em salvamentos contra efeitos de medo.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.UxeoSRmPbD5hjiEi]{Efeito: Presença Inspiradora}

action->Designate Bellflower Crop.name: Designar Cultivo de Campânulas
action->Designate Bellflower Crop.description:
Nolly designa um aliado a até 9 metros como membro de seu cultivo de campânulas. Nolly pode ter até 10 membros em seu cultivo ao mesmo tempo; qualquer membro adicionado em excesso remove automaticamente um membro do cultivo à escolha de Nolly. Quando Nolly ou um membro de seu cultivo @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.HCl3pzVefiv9ZKQW]{Ajuda} um membro do cultivo e obtém sucesso, eles obtêm um sucesso crítico em vez disso.

Quando um membro do cultivo a até 18 metros de Nolly falha em um teste de resistência contra um efeito que imporia as condições @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confuso} ou @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralisado}, o membro do cultivo pode usar uma reação para rerrolar o teste de resistência e usar o melhor dos dois resultados. Este é um efeito de sorte.

action->Liberating Trick.name: Truque Libertador
action->Liberating Trick.description: Nolly se liberta ou liberta uma criatura ao seu alcance da condição @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Agarrado}.

action->Quick Movements.name: Movimentos Rápidos
action->Quick Movements.description: Nolly não aciona reações com seu movimento ou com qualquer uso da perícia Ladinagem.

Phantom Bells.name: Sinos Fantasmagóricos
Phantom Bells.description: O eco de sinos diabólicos reverbera com um clamor que estremece os ossos.
Phantom Bells.disable: @Check[religion|dc:27|name:Recitar Contra o Poder do Inferno|traits:auditory,complex,haunt,sonic,hazard] (perito) para quebrar a maldição com recitações contra o poder do Inferno (2 ações), ou @Check[performance|dc:22|name:Executar uma Composição Oposta|traits:auditory,complex,haunt,sonic,hazard] (perito) para Executar uma composição oposta
Phantom Bells.reset: Os sinos param de tocar se não houver criaturas vivas a até 9 metros.
Phantom Bells.routine: (1 ação) Os sinos tocam, causando @Damage[4d6[sonic]] de dano a cada criatura viva a até @Template[emanation|distance:30]{9 metros} (salvamento básico de @Check[fortitude|dc:24|basic|name:Toque dos Sinos Fantasmagóricos|traits:auditory,complex,haunt,sonic,hazard]).

action->Distant Ringing.name: Toque Distante
action->Distant Ringing.description:
Gatilho Uma criatura viva se aproxima a até 9 metros.

Efeito Sons de metal rangendo enchem a área enquanto os sinos fantasmagóricos começam a balançar e a assombração rola iniciativa.

Precentor.name: Precentor
Precentor.publicNotes:
Velstracs são demônios horríveis que habitam as sombras e buscam a sensação máxima através da automutilação. Eles transcendem seu distanciamento estoico apenas ao infligir dor e terror em suas vítimas, praticando novas formas de degradação e tortura antes de virar suas facas contra si mesmos. Embora os velstracs se considerem além de limitações como moralidade ou tabus mortais, suas vítimas os conhecem como torturadores sem emoção que infligem sofrimento degradado e sádico. Eles afirmam buscar a perfeição no pensamento, na forma e na ação, embora não reconheçam nenhum refinamento que não exija a excisão dolorosa da carne ou do espírito.

Velstracs se manifestam a partir das almas de mortais masoquistas ou sádicos que são desviadas para o Plano das Sombras e então forjadas em formas que se adequam às suas predileções vis, variando dos augures de baixa patente aos interlocutores obcecados pela estética.

Alguns mortais se referem aos velstracs como "kytons", uma atribuição errônea que os velstracs toleram com diversão fria. O termo "kyton" denota um mestre ou virtuoso entre sua espécie, e esses demônios gostam de ser rotulados como mestres de seus horríveis caminhos para a perfeição através da agonia.

Contadores de histórias e historiadores velstracs são conhecidos como precentores. Seguidos por coros horríveis, os precentores se apresentam nas cortes dos demagogos velstracs.

action->Painsight.description: Um precentor automaticamente sabe se uma criatura que ele vê tem alguma das condições @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Condenado}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Morrendo} e @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Yl48xTdMh3aeQYL2]{Ferido}, bem como o valor dessas condições.

action->Unnerving Gaze.name: Olhar Perturbador
action->Unnerving Gaze.description: 9 metros. Quando uma criatura termina seu turno na aura, ela deve obter sucesso em um salvamento de @Check[will|dc:38] ou se tornar @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Condenado 1}.

action->Assemble Choir.name: Reunir Coro
action->Assemble Choir.description: O precentor adiciona uma criatura que é afetada por seu Toque Atormentador e está a até 30 metros ao seu coro de gritos. Um precentor pode ter qualquer número de criaturas em seu coro, embora uma criatura que não seja mais afetada por Toque Atormentador deixe o coro imediatamente. Criaturas no coro de gritos de um precentor ficam @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinadas} umas pelas outras e pelo precentor, e não podem usar ações hostis umas contra as outras ou contra o precentor. Quando o precentor lança uma magia divina inata, ele pode fazer com que o efeito se origine de qualquer membro de seu coro em vez de si mesmo, usando a CD de salvamento e o bônus de ataque do precentor.

action->Focus Gaze.name: Focar Olhar
action->Focus Gaze.description:
O precentor encara uma criatura que pode ver a até 9 metros. O alvo deve imediatamente tentar um salvamento de @Check[will|dc:38|name:Olhar Perturbador|traits:aura] contra o olhar perturbador do precentor.

Além disso, se a criatura já estava @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Condenada}, em uma falha no salvamento, ela vê a pele de seu próprio corpo se descascar, tornando-a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confusa} enquanto permanecer @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Condenada}. Após tentar este salvamento, a criatura fica temporariamente imune até o início do próximo turno do precentor.

action->Tormenting Touch.name: Toque Atormentador
action->Tormenting Touch.description:
O precentor toca uma criatura a até 3 metros, fazendo com que ela grite constantemente de agonia. O alvo deve tentar um salvamento de @Check[will|dc:38].

Enquanto o alvo estiver entorpecido por este efeito, seus gritos contínuos fazem com que ele falhe automaticamente em testes de Furtividade.

Sucesso Crítico O alvo não é afetado.

Sucesso O alvo fica @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Estupefato 1}.

Falha O alvo fica @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Estupefato 3}.

Falha Crítica O alvo fica @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Estupefato 4}.

O alvo pode tentar um novo teste de Vontade no início de cada um de seus turnos, reduzindo a condição de estupefato em 1 a cada salvamento bem-sucedido. Se o alvo reduzir sua condição de estupefato a 0 desta forma, o alvo não será mais afetado.

Longswords can be one-edged or two-edged swords. Their blades are heavy and they're between 3 and 4 feet in length.
