action->Attack of Opportunity (Special).name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.hFtNbo1LKYCoDy2O]
Attack of Opportunity (Special)
action->Attack of Opportunity (Special).description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.hFtNbo1LKYCoDy2O]

A Promise Guard can use Attack of Opportunity when a creature within her reach uses a concentrate action, in addition to its normal trigger. They can disrupt triggering concentrate actions, and they disrupt actions on any hit, not just a critical hit.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.AttackOfOpportunity]

action->Promise Guard Stance.name: Promise Guard Stance
action->Promise Guard Stance.description: A promise guard always has her shield raised as if they had used the Raise a Shield action, as long as they meet that action's requirements.

action->Shield Warden.name: Shield Warden
action->Shield Warden.description: A Promise guard can use their Shield Block reaction to prevent damage to an adjacent ally.

action->Shield Shove.name: Shield Shove
action->Shield Shove.description: The Promise guard makes a Strike with their longsword, then attempts to push the target back. If the Strike hits, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the start of the guard's next turn, and the guard can automatically Shove the target, with the same benefits as the Shove action (including the critical success effect if the Strike was a critical hit). If the guard moves to follow the target, this movement doesn't trigger reactions. In addition, if the target has to stop moving because it would hit an object, it takes damage equal to the guard's Strength modifier.

action->Sudden Charge.name: Sudden Charge
action->Sudden Charge.description: The Promise guard Strides up to double their Speed. If the guard ends their movement within melee reach of at least one enemy, they can make a melee Strike against that enemy.

Quarry Sluiceway.name: Comporta da Pedreira
Quarry Sluiceway.description: Seis comportas se abrem para permitir que milhares de galões de água comecem a inundar a sala. A água agita-se pela sala e flui por três calhas na extremidade sul da sala.
Quarry Sluiceway.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:28|name:Fechar uma Comporta|traits:complex,mechanical,trap,hazard] (perito) duas vezes para fechar uma comporta (em um sucesso crítico, uma comporta é fechada imediatamente)
Quarry Sluiceway.reset: A armadilha é reiniciada se todas as seis comportas forem fechadas. Se toda a água tiver escoado quando isso ocorrer, a água levará muitos meses para encher novamente.
Quarry Sluiceway.routine:
(6 ações) A armadilha perde 1 ação por comporta desativada ou destruída. Em cada uma de suas ações, a água jorrando das comportas flui pela sala, criando um rio de água agitada que enche a sala até alguns centímetros e torna o chão da câmara terreno difícil. O nível da água nunca sobe acima desse nível na sala, pois escoa pelas calhas ao sul e começa a inundar a pedreira (área J2). No segundo turno da armadilha, a água começa a encher as quatro fossas de escravos na área J2. Cada uma das ações da armadilha enche as fossas em 10 centímetros (60 centímetros por rodada se todas as comportas estiverem funcionando). Se as fossas de escravos encherem até sua profundidade total de 3,6 metros e as grades sobre as fossas de escravos não estiverem abertas, os escravos começam a se afogar, morrendo se não forem libertados em 5 rodadas. Uma vez que as fossas de escravos estejam cheias, a água continua a encher lentamente a área central ao longo de uma hora até esvaziar o reservatório e inundar a área J2 a uma profundidade de 4,5 metros.

Outras opções além de desativar ou destruir as comportas podem impedir a inundação da pedreira a seu critério.
Quarry Sluiceway.stealth: (perito) ou @Check[perception|dc:27|name:Notar Comportas|traits:complex,mechanical,trap,hazard] (perito) para notar as seis comportas habilmente escondidas enquanto estiverem fechadas

action->Opened Sluices.name: Comportas Abertas
action->Opened Sluices.description:
Gatilho Uma criatura @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pvQ5rY2zrtPI614F]{Interage} para acionar a alavanca primária ou a alavanca de segurança.

Efeito A armadilha rola iniciativa.

action->Tail Swipe.name: Ataque de Cauda
action->Tail Swipe.description:
Gatilho Uma criatura ao alcance da cauda de Racharak usa uma ação de movimento ou deixa um quadrado durante uma ação de movimento que está usando.

Efeito Racharak faz um ataque de cauda na criatura com uma penalidade de -2. Se acertar, ela interrompe a ação da criatura.

action->Breath Weapon.name: Arma de Sopro
action->Breath Weapon.description:
Racharak solta chamas que causam @Damage[9d6[fire]|options:area-damage] de dano a todas as criaturas em um @Template[cone|distance:30] (teste de resistência de @Check[reflexos|dc:26|basic]).

Ela não pode usar Arma de Sopro novamente por [[/gmr 1d4 #Recarregar Arma de Sopro]]{1d4 rodadas}

action->Draconic Frenzy.name: Frenesi Dracônico
action->Draconic Frenzy.description: Racharak faz dois ataques de garra e um ataque de mordida em qualquer ordem.

action->Shrieking Frenzy.name: Frenesi Gritante
action->Shrieking Frenzy.description:
Gatilho O turno de Racharak começa.

Frequência uma vez por hora

Efeito Racharak fica @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Acelerada} até o final de seu turno e pode usar a ação extra para Andar ou Atacar. Enquanto estiver em frenesi, Racharak não pode falar e falha criticamente em todos os testes de Furtividade, devido ao seu grito alto.

action->Thrown Weapon Mastery.name: Maestria em Arma Arremessada
action->Thrown Weapon Mastery.description: Quando Racharak arremessa uma arma, a arma ganha a característica de arma mortal d6. Quando ela arremessa uma arma improvisada, ela não sofre a penalidade de -2 por usar uma arma improvisada, nem sofre a penalidade por usar essa arma para fazer um ataque letal em vez de um ataque não letal.

Remnant of Barzillai.name: Remanescente de Barzillai
Remnant of Barzillai.publicNotes:
Embora os Corvos de Prata tenham derrotado o tirano maligno Barzillai Thrune antes que ele pudesse realizar totalmente seu objetivo de se tornar um genius loci, remanescentes de seu espírito permanecem por toda a região de Ravounel. Ocasionalmente, esses fragmentos de senciência formam um corpo vago em forma de Barzillai a partir de pedaços do terreno próximo, mas quando perto de locais assombrados, a força espectral pode se coalescer em um corpo mais preciso usando ectoplasma sifonado dessas assombrações. Em qualquer forma, o remanescente carrega uma forma da própria maça flamejante de Barzillai, que se dissolve em uma névoa fina 1 hora após o remanescente ser destruído.

Remanescentes de Barzillai podem se manifestar em qualquer lugar de Ravounel e, mesmo depois que um remanescente é derrotado, outro pode surgir mais tarde. O inquisidor morto-vivo só pode ser posto para descansar permanentemente recuperando sua maça antes que ela desapareça e, em seguida, enterrando-a em um local consagrado por clérigos bondosos, onde deve permanecer por pelo menos um ano sem ser perturbada.

Embora um remanescente de Barzillai possa extrair poder de qualquer assombração à qual esteja associado, os remanescentes tendem a fazê-lo com assombrações específicas. As assombrações apresentadas são comumente associadas a remanescentes de Barzillai. Estas estão longe de ser as únicas assombrações que Barzillai pode criar; os registros dos Corvos de Prata mencionam muitos fenômenos associados ao ser morto-vivo, alguns dos quais lidam com temas de vários pássaros, os aromas de hortelã e chá e figuras fantasmagóricas em armaduras pesadas.

action->Haunted Form.name: Forma Assombrada
action->Haunted Form.description: O remanescente de Barzillai se alimenta do poder das assombrações, reforçando sua forma quando elas estão por perto. Sua resistência a todos os danos aumenta para 12 enquanto ele estiver a até 18 metros de uma assombração. Quando uma assombração a até 18 metros de Barzillai é desativada, ele sofre @Damage[20[force]] de dano de reação.

action->Create Haunt.name: Criar Assombração
action->Create Haunt.description:
Frequência três vezes por dia

Requisitos O remanescente de Barzillai está em Ravounel.

Efeito O remanescente de Barzillai agita e amplifica espíritos inquietos na área para criar uma única assombração de 6º nível ou inferior em sua localização atual. Esta assombração é permanente até ser desativada ou o remanescente de Barzillai ser destruído.

tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.hFtNbo1LKYCoDy2O]

Rinnarv can use Attack of Opportunity when a creature within his reach uses a concentrate action, in addition to its normal trigger. He can disrupt triggering concentrate actions, and he disrupts actions on any hit, not just a critical hit.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.AttackOfOpportunity]

action->Blood Magic.name: Blood Magic
action->Blood Magic.description: When Rinnarv casts one of his bloodline spells or a spell from his list of granted spells, he creates an aura that protects himself or one of the targets of the spell. The aura grants a +1 status bonus to saving throws for 1 round.

action->Spell Strike.name: Spell Strike
action->Spell Strike.description:
Frequency once per round

Trigger Rinnarv begins to Cast a Spell that targets at least 1 creature

Effect Rinnarv channels his spell through his blade. He makes a Strike with his blade against a target within reach. If the Strike is successful, the target is automatically subject to the spell. If the spell required an attack roll, the target is hit. If the spell required a saving throw, the target takes a -4 status penalty to its saving throw instead. If the spell could target multiple creatures, it targets only the creature Rinnarv hit with his Strike.

Rusty Mae.saveDetails: +1 de status em todos os salvamentos contra magia

action->Coven.name: Coven
action->Coven.description:
Rusty Mae adiciona @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gPvtmKMRpg9I9D7H]{Aprisionar na Terra}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.115Xp9E38CJENhNS]{Passagem Mágica} e @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.8Umt1AzYfFbC4fui]{Ruína Mágica} às magias de seu coven.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Coven]

action->Bonds of Iron.name: Laços de Ferro
action->Bonds of Iron.description: Uma vez por dia, Rusty Mae pode fazer com que uma gaiola construída de unhas de ferro frio surja do nada a um alcance de até 9 metros, tentando um teste de Atletismo para [[/act grapple]] contra a CD de Fortitude do alvo; se o alvo tiver uma fraqueza a ferro frio, Rusty Mae ganha um bônus de circunstância de +2 neste teste. Diferente de um Agarrar normal, Rusty Mae não precisa estar ao alcance e pode se mover como quiser, e uma tentativa bem-sucedida dura até que a criatura [[/act escape dc=29]]{Escape} (CD 29), fazendo com que a gaiola se desfaça em ferrugem. Qualquer criatura pode tentar destruir a gaiola atacando-a. Ela tem CA 25, Dureza 14 e 56 Pontos de Vida.

action->Change Shape.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.eQM5hQ1W3d1uen97]

Rusty Mae can take on the appearance of any Medium female humanoid. This doesn't change her Speed or her attack and damage bonuses with her Strikes but might change the damage type her Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.3JOi2cMcGhT3eze1]

action->Rust.name: Ferrugem
action->Rust.description: As garras de Rusty Mae fazem com que o metal enferruje e corroa rapidamente. Se ela obtiver sucesso em um Strike de garras ou em uma tentativa de @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Desarmar}, ela causa [[/r {2d6}]]{2d6 de dano} (dobrado em um acerto crítico) a um item de metal que o alvo esteja vestindo ou segurando, ignorando sua Dureza, além do dano que ela causa ao alvo com suas garras. Se ela atingir um item de metal desacompanhado, o item sofre [[/r {2d6}]]{2d6 de dano} automaticamente. Se uma criatura usar a reação Bloqueio com Escudo com um escudo de metal contra o ataque de garra de Rusty Mae, o escudo é automaticamente @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6dNUvdb1dhToNDj3]{Quebrado}, mas nenhum outro item é afetado naquele ataque.

action->Telekinetic Defense.name: Telekinetic Defense
action->Telekinetic Defense.description:
Trigger A creature approaches within 10 feet of the poltergeist.

Effect The poltergeist makes a telekinetic object Strike against the triggering creature.

action->Frighten.name: Frighten
action->Frighten.description:
Requirement The poltergeist must be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}.

Effect The poltergeist becomes visible, appearing as a skeletal, ghostlike humanoid. Each creature within 30 feet must attempt a @Check[will|dc:33] save, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a failure. On a critical failure, it's also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for as long as it's frightened. On a success, the creature is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

At the start of its next turn, the poltergeist becomes invisible again.

action->Telekinetic Storm.name: Telekinetic Storm
action->Telekinetic Storm.description:
The poltergeist telekinetically throws numerous small and jagged chunks of stone rubble, either spreading them out among multiple foes or directing them at one target.

  • When this effect is spread out among multiple foes, the poltergeist makes a telekinetic object Strike at a -2 penalty against each creature within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet}. These count as one attack for the poltergeist's multiple attack penalty, and the penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks.
  • When this effect has only one target, the poltergeist makes a telekinetic object Strike against the target, and the damage increases to 6d12. It deals @Damage[2d12[untyped]] damage on a failure, and no damage on a critical failure.

tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.zo0ophqfKunJFxZN]

Lethargy poison is commonly used in hit-and-run tactics by drow and others who want their victims alive; the ambusher retreats until the poison sets in and the victim falls unconscious. Further exposure to lethargy poison does not require the target to attempt additional saving throws; only failing an saving throw against an ongoing exposure can progress its stage.

Activate 2 Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:18]

Maximum Duration 4 hours

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 slowed 1 (1 minute)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} with no Perception check to wake up (1 round)

Stage 4 unconscious with no Perception check to wake up ([[/gmr 1d4 #hours]]{1d4 hours}).

action->Efficient Capture.name: Efficient Capture
action->Efficient Capture.description:
Requirements The Scarlet Triad agent has manacles in hand and is adjacent to a creature.

Effect The Scarlet Triad agent attempts to bind the creature's wrists or ankles with the manacles. If they succeed at an attack roll with a [[/r 1d20+24]]{+24 modifier} against the target's AC, they apply the manacles.

action->Precise Debilitations.name: Precise Debilitations
action->Precise Debilitations.description:
Trigger The Scarlet Triad agent's Strike hits an off-guard creature and deals damage.

Effect The Scarlet Triad agent applies one of the following debilitations to the creature, which lasts until the end of their next turn.

  • Brow Gash The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}.
  • Deep Cut The target takes an additional 2d6 precision damage from the Scarlet Triad agent's attacks.
  • Hamstring The target takes a -10-foot status penalty to its Speeds.
  • Low Blow The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.otUESSH8BDdPKHtb]{Effect: Hamstring}

0.text: f The Scarlet Triad agent applies one of the following debilitations to the creature, which lasts until the end of their next turn.

The scarlet triad agent deals an extra 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Weapon Trick.name: Weapon Trick
action->Weapon Trick.description: When the Scarlet Triad agent critically succeeds at an attack roll against an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creature, they apply the critical specialization effect for the weapon they are wielding.

equipment->Thieves' Tools (Infiltrator).description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.6nrCxNQFycUVFOV2]

You need thieves' tools to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2EE4aF4SZpYf0R6H]{Pick Locks} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]{Disable Devices} (of some types) using the Thievery skill. Infiltrator thieves' tools add a +1 item bonus to checks to Pick Locks and Disable Devices.

If your thieves' tools are broken, you can repair them by replacing the lock picks with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.BznmPaRjI4Orb0IH]{Replacement Picks} appropriate to your tools; this doesn't require using the Repair action. If you wear your thieves' tools, you can draw and replace them as part of the action that uses them.

Alchemists have refined the devastatingly allergenic pollen of the widow orchid to create this venom, which swiftly causes the victim's eyes to leak mucus and swell shut.

Stage 2 @Damage[7d6[poison]] damage, dazzled, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[8d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} (1 round)

action->Return Fire.description:
Trigger The Scarlet Triad boss is the target of a physical ranged attack

Effect They gain a +4 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the attack misses and the boss has their shortbow in hand, the boss Strikes the attacker with their shortbow.

action->Darting Shot.name: Darting Shot
action->Darting Shot.description: The Scarlet Triad boss Feints a target, Strides up to their Speed, and makes a Strike with their shortbow in any order. They can Feint any target within 30 feet when using this ability.

action->Batter the Fallen.name: Esmagar o Caído
action->Batter the Fallen.description: Os Strikes de chute do Brutamontes da Tríade Escarlate causam 2d6 de dano extra a criaturas @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Caídas}.

action->Brutal Cleave.name: Golpe Brutal
action->Brutal Cleave.description:
Gatilho O Strike corpo a corpo do brutamontes mata uma criatura ou a deixa @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Inconsciente}, e outro inimigo está adjacente a essa criatura.

Efeito O brutamontes faz outro Strike corpo a corpo contra o segundo inimigo com a mesma penalidade de ataque múltiplo do Strike que acionou o efeito.

action->Efficient Capture.name: Captura Eficiente
action->Efficient Capture.description:
Requisitos O brutamontes tem algemas na mão e está adjacente a uma criatura.

Efeito O brutamontes tenta prender os pulsos ou tornozelos da criatura com as algemas. Ele deve obter sucesso em uma rolagem de ataque com um modificador de [[/r 1d20+23 #Manacles]]{+23} contra a CA do alvo.

action->Pummeling Flurry.name: Rajada de Pancadas
action->Pummeling Flurry.description:
Frequência uma vez por turno

Efeito O brutamontes faz um Strike com o tacape grande e um Strike de chute. Se ambos atingirem a mesma criatura, combine o dano para fins de resistências e fraquezas.

action->Stunning Retort.name: Stunning Retort
action->Stunning Retort.description:
Trigger An enemy critically fails a Strike against the enforcer

Effect The enforcer Strikes with their sap against that enemy if they're within reach; otherwise, the enforcer attempts an Intimidation check to [[/act demoralize]] that enemy.

action->Dual Abuse.name: Dual Abuse
action->Dual Abuse.description:
The enforcer uses the pain of one attack as an opening to deal a devastating second blow. The enforcer makes two attacks against the same target: a scimitar Strike and sap Strike (in any order) or two composite shortbow Strikes. If both attacks hit, the second attack deals an additional 3d6 damage, and the enforcer gives the target one of the following conditions until the end of the enforcer's next turn: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

This counts as two attacks when calculating the enforcer's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks.

action->Efficient Capture.name: Efficient Capture
action->Efficient Capture.description:
Requirements The enforcer has manacles in hand and is adjacent to a creature

Effect The enforcer attempts to bind the creature's wrists or ankles with the manacles. If the enforcer succeeds at an attack roll with a [[/r 1d20+30 #Manacles]]{+30 modifier} against the target's AC, they apply the manacles.

You inflict despair on creatures in the area. The effects for each creature are determined by its Will save.

Success For 1 round, the creature can't use reactions and must attempt another save at the start of its turn; on a failure, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for that turn as it sobs uncontrollably.

Failure As success, but the duration is 1 minute.

consumable->Addlebrain.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.d5aCuFS1dhKXhsZ0]

Certain Scarlet Triad poisoners use toxins like addlebrain to keep captured prisoners docile and compliant for short periods of time until they can be properly shackled and imprisoned. Addlebrain is distilled from a hallucinogenic lichen that can often be found growing in the sewers below particularly large cities like Katapesh.

Once soaked in special reagents and then dried, a dose of addlebrain must be either lit with flame or tossed into a fire to activate, whereupon it unleashes a cloud of toxin as normal for an inhaled poison.

Activate A Interact (Inhaled)

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:25]

Onset 1 minute

Maximum Duration 1 day

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (10 minutes)

Stage 2 Enfeebled 2 and stupefied 2 (1 hour)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}, enfeebled 4, and stupefied 4 (1 day)

consumable->Antidote (Greater).description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.XWkeL34yJK6t5qUE]

Activate A Interact

An antidote protects you against toxins. Upon drinking an antidote, you gain a +4 item bonus to Fortitude saving throws against poisons for 6 hours.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.TjBxxlTvb6tJP1jS]{Effect: Antidote}

action->Running Poison Strike.description:
Frequência três vezes por dia

Efeito O envenenador se Desloca, envenenando sua arma enquanto se move. O envenenador move-se até sua Velocidade e faz um Strike corpo a corpo que causa @Damage[2d8[poison]] de dano. Isso não tem efeito em um Strike que já causa dano de veneno.

tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.zvLyCVD8g2PdHJAc]

You need thieves' tools to Pick Locks or Disable Devices (of some types) using the Thievery skill.

If your thieves' tools are broken, you can repair them by replacing the lock picks with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Sw7MBLASN3xK4Y44]{Replacement Picks} appropriate to your tools; this doesn't require using the Repair action.

consumable->Bloodseeker Beak (Affixed to.name:

Activate F Envision

Trigger You hit an off-guard creature with the affixed weapon

When you activate the beak, you deal an extra 1d4 precision damage on your damage roll. If you deal sneak attack damage to the creature, you also deal @Damage[1d4[bleed]].

action->Deny Advantage.name: Negar Vantagem
action->Deny Advantage.description: O ladino não está @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenido} contra criaturas @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Ocultas}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Indetectáveis} ou flanqueadoras de 6º nível ou inferior, ou criaturas de 6º nível ou inferior usando ataque surpresa.

action->Mobility.name: Mobilidade
action->Mobility.description: Quando o ladino realiza uma ação de Deslocamento para se mover metade de sua Velocidade ou menos, esse movimento não aciona reações.

action->Nimble Dodge.name: Esquiva Ágil
action->Nimble Dodge.description:
Requisito Um ladino não pode usar esta reação enquanto estiver sobrecarregado.

Gatilho O ladino é atingido por um ataque feito por uma criatura que o ladino pode ver.

Efeito O ladino ganha um bônus de circunstância de +2 em sua Classe de Armadura contra o ataque que acionou o efeito.

action->Efficient Capture.name: Captura Eficiente
action->Efficient Capture.description:
Requisitos O ladino tem algemas na mão e está adjacente a uma criatura.

Efeito O ladino tenta prender os pulsos ou tornozelos da criatura com as algemas. Se o ladino obtiver sucesso em uma rolagem de ataque com um modificador de [[/r 1d20+16 #Manacles]]{+16} contra a CA do alvo, ele aplica as algemas.

action->Sneak Attack.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.AWvNPE4U0kEJSL1T]

The scarlet triad sneak deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Surprise Attack.name: Ataque Surpresa
action->Surprise Attack.description: Na primeira rodada de combate, criaturas que ainda não agiram estão @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenidas} contra o ladino.

action->Backshot.name: Tiro de Cobertura
action->Backshot.description:
Gatilho Uma criatura que o atirador pode ver erra um Strike de arma de alcance contra ele.

Efeito O atirador tenta um Strike de alcance contra a criatura que acionou o efeito com uma penalidade de -2.

action->Rain of Arrows.name: Chuva de Flechas
action->Rain of Arrows.description: O atirador dispara uma flecha em cada criatura que ele escolher dentro de uma @Template[burst|distance:15]. O centro da área deve estar a até 30 metros do atirador, mas não pode estar a menos de 9 metros. O atirador faz cada rolagem de ataque separadamente. Todos os ataques contam para a penalidade de ataque múltiplo do atirador, mas a penalidade aumenta apenas depois que todos os ataques são feitos.

action->Sneak Attack.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.AWvNPE4U0kEJSL1T]

The scarlet triad sniper deals an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Swiftness.name: Agilidade
action->Swiftness.description: O movimento do atirador não aciona reações.

action->+2 Circumstance to All Saves vs..name: +2 de Circunstância em Todos os Salvamentos contra Empurrar, Derrubar ou Ser Derrubado

action->Bully's Push.name: Empurrão do Valentão
action->Bully's Push.description:
Gatilho Uma criatura dentro do alcance do capanga erra um Strike corpo a corpo contra ele.

Efeito O capanga tenta @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Empurrar} a criatura que acionou o efeito com uma penalidade de -2. Se o capanga obtiver uma falha crítica, ele obtém uma falha em vez disso.

action->Rock Dwarf.name: Anão Rochoso
action->Rock Dwarf.description: Quando forçado a se mover 3 metros ou mais, o capanga se move apenas metade da distância.

action->Efficient Capture.name: Captura Eficiente
action->Efficient Capture.description:
Requisitos O capanga tem algemas na mão e está próximo a uma criatura.

Efeito O capanga tenta prender os pulsos ou tornozelos da criatura com as algemas. O capanga deve obter sucesso em uma rolagem de ataque com um modificador de [[/r 1d20+18 #Manacles]]{+18} contra a CA do alvo.

action->Pack Attack.name: Ataque em Bando
action->Pack Attack.description: O capanga causa 1d8 de dano extra a qualquer criatura que esteja ao alcance de pelo menos dois dos aliados do capanga.

Seismic Spears Trap.name: Seismic Spears Trap
Seismic Spears Trap.description: Lines of searing lava lance through the area, causing targets to shake as if caught in an earthquake and potentially become petrified.
Seismic Spears Trap.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:43|name:Disable the Wards|traits:magical,trap] (master) to disable the wards or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9th rank; counteract DC 38) to counteract the ward.

action->Cataclysmic Rain.name: Cataclysmic Rain
action->Cataclysmic Rain.description:
Trigger A creature enters the marked area

Effect Fiery spears make one Strike against each living creature within 5 feet of the marked area.

action->Personal Quake.name: Personal Quake
action->Personal Quake.description: A creature struck by a seismic spear is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 3} for 1 round as their body shakes uncontrollably. On a critical hit, a target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:39] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Petrified} for 1 minute, or permanently on a critical failure.

strike-melee->Seismic Spear.name: Seismic Spear
strike-melee->Seismic Spear.description: No MAP applies to strikes made by seismic spear attacks

action->No MAP.name: No MAP
action->No MAP.description: The Seismic Spear Strikes do not apply a MAP.

armor->Half Plate.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.pRoikbRo5HFW6YUB]

Half plate consists of most of the upper body plates used in full plate, with lighter or sparser steel plate protection for the arms and legs. This provides some of the protection of full plate with greater flexibility and speed. A suit of this armor comes with an undercoat of padded armor and a pair of gauntlets.

action->Command Skeletons.name: Command Skeletons
action->Command Skeletons.description: The skeletal Hellknight can direct the actions of the nearby skeleton guards, commanding them to perform tactics such as flanking foes and focusing their attacks on specific targets. As long as the skeletal Hellknight is active and commanding the skeletons, they gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.hFtNbo1LKYCoDy2O]{Attack of Opportunity} reaction.

action->Invoke Reckoning.name: Invoke Reckoning
action->Invoke Reckoning.description:
Trigger The skeletal Hellknight hits a foe with a Strike.

Effect The skeletal Hellknight causes the creature struck to endure the pain of an Order of the Nail's reckoning-a rite of mortification Hellknights of that order use to focus their minds. The creature struck feels as if nails are being driven into their body, and must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:17|traits:damaging-effect] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} from the pain. On a critical failure, the pain manifests as actual puncture wounds, dealing an additional @Damage[2d6[piercing]] damage to the victim.

Soulbound Ruin.name: Soulbound Ruin
Soulbound Ruin.languages: other languages typical to the region
Soulbound Ruin.publicNotes: Those who tread in ruined places sometimes speak of a sense that a supernatural presence is there alongside them, as if the spirits of the dead were watching intently. Such presences can be very real, often taking the form of ghosts or other shades of undead that cannot let go of their attachment to the Material Plane. But sometimes, instead of manifesting as distinct spirits, the souls of the dead infuse the very stone and mortar around them. When enough souls attach themselves to a single place-be it a home, crypt, or castle-it can take on a life of its own, becoming a soulbound ruin.
Soulbound Ruin.source: Pathfinder #148: Fires of the Haunted City

action->Impede.name: Impede
action->Impede.description:
Frequency once per turn

Trigger A creature within the soulbound ruin uses an action with the move trait.

Effect The soulbound ruin reacts violently to stop the creature's movement, shooting spikes, throwing bricks, or otherwise impeding the target. The target must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:35] save or fall @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

action->Vulnerability to Exorcism.name: Vulnerability to Exorcism
action->Vulnerability to Exorcism.description: When a soulbound ruin fails a saving throw against a spell that would banish tormented spirits or manipulate souls, such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.bay4AfSu2iIozNNW]{Banishment} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GYmXvS9NJ7QwfWGg]{Seize Soul}, instead of experiencing the listed effects, it takes [[/r 10]]{10 damage} per spell rank.

action->Collapse Ceiling.name: Collapse Ceiling
action->Collapse Ceiling.description:
The ruin collapses up to three 10-foot by 10-foot sections of its ceiling. The ruin takes [[/r {10}]]{10 damage} per section it collapses, and it can't collapse the same section until it has been repaired.

Each creature in one of these areas takes @Damage[8d10[bludgeoning]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:35|basic] save. On a failed save, the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} under the rubble until it Escapes (DC 33).

action->Pervasive Attacks.name: Pervasive Attacks
action->Pervasive Attacks.description: A soulbound ruin's edifice Strikes can target any creature inside the ruin.

action->Self-Repair.name: Self-Repair
action->Self-Repair.description:
The ruin can spend 10 minutes repairing itself to regain up to @Damage[30[healing]] Hit Points. If the ruin is interrupted during this time, it loses its focus and the repair fails.

This ability functions even if the ruin is reduced to 0 HP, unless a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Dbd5W6G8U2vzWolN]{Consecrate} ritual has been performed to purify the building, in which case the soulbound ruin is destroyed. This ritual must be dedicated to a good deity or a deity with a strong opposition to undead, such as Pharasma.

action->Tail Swipe.name: Tail Swipe
action->Tail Swipe.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the spawn's tail uses a move action or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

Effect The spawn of Dahak makes a tail Strike at the creature with a -2 penalty. If it hits, they disrupt the creature's action.

action->Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
action->Breath Weapon.description:
The spawn breathes flames that deals @Damage[9d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to all creatures in a @Template[cone|distance:30] (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic] save).

They can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}

action->Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
action->Draconic Frenzy.description: The spawn makes two claw Strikes and one bite Strike in any order.

action->Shrieking Frenzy.name: Shrieking Frenzy
action->Shrieking Frenzy.description:
Trigger The spawn's turn begins.

Frequency once per hour

Effect The spawn is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} until the end of their turn, and can use the extra action to Stride or Strike. While in the frenzy, the spawn can't speak and automatically critically fails Stealth checks, due to their loud wailing.

action->Thrown Weapon Mastery.name: Thrown Weapon Mastery
action->Thrown Weapon Mastery.description: When the spawn throws a weapon, the weapon gains the deadly d6 weapon trait. When they throw an improvised weapon, they don't take the -2 penalty for using an improvised weapon, nor do they take the penalty for using that weapon to make a lethal attack instead of a nonlethal attack.

Spiked Doorframe.name: Spiked Doorframe
Spiked Doorframe.description: Spikes lance out of the doorframe to skewer anyone who attempts to open the door.
Spiked Doorframe.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:20|name:Deactivate Trigger|traits:hazard,mechanical,trap,action:disable-a-device] (trained) to deactivate a trigger built into the door's handle

action->Spikes.name: Spikes
action->Spikes.description:
Trigger The door is opened.

Effect The trap makes an attack against the creature that opened the door.

Spiritbound Aluum.name: Spiritbound Aluum
Spiritbound Aluum.publicNotes:
Whereas most aluums are animated by the souls of volunteers loyal to Katapesh, the Pactmasters created a handful of more capable (and deadly) aluums powered by the souls of a dozen or more dangerous criminals. These spiritbound aluums are rarely used as peacekeepers, instead serving as assassins, elite bodyguards, or riot control during times of martial law.

A spiritbound aluum has a dull blue crystalline focus that stores constituent souls, surrounded by a host of smaller gems used for trapping souls the Pactmasters wish to deny from entering the Great Beyond. Spiritbound aluums rarely use this soul-binding ability except when instructed by their masters. However, the murderous or embittered souls within the aluum sometimes exert control and willfully consume a departing soul either out of malice or to incorporate it into the construct's core. If not relieved of its trapped souls in a timely manner, a spiritbound aluum can develop enough will to overcome its masters' orders and even awaken to full sentience. These rogue aluums typically lose the mindless trait, are evil, have an Intelligence modifier of -2 or higher, and gain several skills with bonuses ranging from +25 to +32.

Aluums are powerful metal and stone constructs originally created by the Pactmasters to maintain order in Katapesh. The construction of each aluum includes the creation of an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.bU731I8njNmSAQhQ]{Aluum Charm}, a brass pendant set with a blue crystal designed to control that particular construct. The charm constructed at the same time as an aluum is called its linked charm.

spell->Bind Soul.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GYmXvS9NJ7QwfWGg]
Bind Soul

action->Aluum Antimagic.name: Aluum Antimagic
action->Aluum Antimagic.description: Spiritbound aluums are immune to spells and magical abilities, with two exceptions. A void spell or magical ability grants a spiritbound aluum the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} condition until the end of its next turn instead of its normal effects. A vitality spell or ability makes a spiritbound aluum @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until the end of its next turn instead of its normal effects.

action->Obliteration Beam.name: Obliteration Beam
action->Obliteration Beam.description:
Requirements The spiritbound aluum has bound a soul using its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GYmXvS9NJ7QwfWGg]{Seize Soul} innate spell

Effect The spiritbound aluum transforms the captured soul's essence into raw magical energy, channeling the spirit into a beam that deals @Damage[20d6[force]] damage in a @Template[line|distance:30] (@Check[reflex|dc:38|basic] save). The remaining fragments of the captured soul are released to the Great Beyond.

The spiritbound aluum can't use Obliteration Beam again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Obliteration Beam]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Paralyzing Force.name: Paralyzing Force

On a critical failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for [[/gmr 1d4 #minutes]]{1d4 minutes} and falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

action->Soul Binder.name: Soul Binder
action->Soul Binder.description:
When a spiritbound aluum uses its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GYmXvS9NJ7QwfWGg]{Seize Soul} innate spell, it binds the soul into its central crystal instead of the normal material component. The crystal can hold up to 60 souls.

When encountered, a spiritbound aluum's crystal typically contains [[/gmr 1d6 #souls]]{1d6 souls}.

action->Soul Shriek.name: Soul Shriek
action->Soul Shriek.description:
The aluum enforcer emits a keening wail in a @Template[cone|distance:15] that deals @Damage[16d6[sonic]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:27|basic] save). A creature that fails its save is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3} on a critical failure.

The aluum can't use Soul Shriek again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Soul Shriek]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Site Bound (Jewelgate Way Statio.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.BcSlVpaN72LoQ5BV]

Jewelgate Way Station

A typical ghost can stray only a short distance from where it was killed or the place it haunts. A typical limit is 120 feet. Some ghosts are instead bound to a room, building, item, or creature that was special to it rather than a location.

action->Rejuvenation.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.unR8VVR4yyRnsmnB]
Rejuvenation
action->Rejuvenation.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.unR8VVR4yyRnsmnB]

Talamira's ghost is bound to the way station by the presence of the wailing crystals; if this hazard is deactivated or destroyed, Talamira sighs in relief as her memories are restored-this burst of psychic energy suffuses all PCs in the area, granting them access to the ancient tradition of magic she once followed, that of the crystal keeper archetype. A moment later, Talamira fades away, her soul moving on to the afterlife.

When a ghost is destroyed, it re-forms after [[/br 2d4 #days]]{2d4 days} within the location it's bound to, fully healed. A ghost can be permanently destroyed only if someone determines the reason for its existence and sets right whatever prevents the spirit from resting.

action->Resonant Wail.name: Resonant Wail
action->Resonant Wail.description:
Talamira releases an anguish-filled cry of despair. All creatures within 30 feet must attempt a @Check[will|dc:33] save to resist.

Talamira can't use Resonant Wail for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Resonant Wail]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature wails with anguish for 3 rounds. The shrieks resonate within the room's wailing crystals, giving the crystals a +2 status bonus on attack rolls against that creature during this time.

Failure As success, but the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 minute as it sobs uncontrollably. If the creature is already slowed 1 by crushing despair, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} as long as it's under both effects simultaneously.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3} from its overwhelming sadness.

action->Telekinetic Crystalline Assault.name: Telekinetic Crystalline Assault
action->Telekinetic Crystalline Assault.description: Talamira fills the air with whirling crystals, dealing @Damage[7d6[slashing]] damage to all creatures in a @Template[emanation|distance:30] (@Check[reflex|dc:33|basic] save).

Tarrasque, The Armageddon Engine.name: Tarrasque, The Armageddon Engine
Tarrasque, The Armageddon Engine.publicNotes:
The most powerful spawn is Tarrasque, whose legend spread across countless worlds beyond Golarion. Its destruction of the nation of Ninshabur and its march across Avistan in -632 AR culminated in the destruction of the flying Shory city of Kho before this spawn was sealed away in a remote cavern.

The spawn are titanic terrors of immense size and strength that live only to destroy. Tarrasque and Xotani are but two of Rovagug's spawn. Others, including Chemnosit (the Monarch Worm), Kothogaz (the Dance of Disharmony), and Volnagur (the End-Singer) hold places of horror in the history of various regions, but the most famed is Ulunat (the Unholy First), whose beetle-like carcass remains sprawled in Sothis, the capital of Osirion.
Tarrasque, The Armageddon Engine.saveDetails: +2 status to all saves vs. magic

action->Carapace.description: Tarrasque is immune to cones, lines, rays, and magic missile spells. These effects bounce harmlessly off its scales.

It's also immune to penalties to its Speeds, and it ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain.

action->Destructive Frenzy.name: Destructive Frenzy

action->Spine Volley.name: Spine Volley

Tarrasque flings spines in a @Template[cone|distance:120], dealing @Damage[(3d10+20)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature in the area (@Check[reflex|dc:53|basic|options:area-effect] save).

Tarrasque can't use Spine Volley again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Spine Volley]]{1d4 rounds}.

Teyam Ishtori.name: Teyam Ishtori
Teyam Ishtori.publicNotes:
Demiliches are formed when a lich, through carelessness or by accident, loses its phylactery. As years pass, the lich's body crumbles to dust, leaving only the skull as the seat of its necromantic power. The lich enters a sort of torpor, its mind left wandering the planes in search of ever greater mysteries. The lich gradually loses the ability to cast spells and its magic items slowly subsume into its new form. Void energy concentrates around the skull, causing some of its bones and teeth to petrify with power and turn into blight crystals. The resulting lich skull, embedded with arcane gemstones and suffused with palpably powerful magic, forms a creature called a demilich.

Despite its near-constant state of inactivity, a demilich grows restless from time to time, especially when living creatures draw near. Only then does the demilich's hunger for life stir once more, causing it to lash out with terrifying bursts of power in attempts to consume vital energy. Unlike an ordinary lich, should the demilich's skull be destroyed, its bond to the world is permanently severed, although some theorize that even then it is not truly slain. Rather, some think that once the demilich is destroyed, its foul and tormented mind is finally free to wander the planes and find new ways to enact its will. For the short-lived common folk of the Material Plane, this is good enough, though eons later a demilich may reappear in the region it once inhabited with a new—and even more insidious—agenda.

To gain more time to complete their goals, some desperate spellcasters pursue immortality by embracing undeath. After long years of research and the creation of a special container called a phylactery, a spellcaster takes the final step by imbibing a deadly concoction or casting dreadful incantations that transform them into a lich. While most undertake this drastic plan to continue their work or fulfill some long-term plan, others become liches because they fear death or to fulfill some malevolent purpose, such as long-sworn revenge. Regardless, the result is permanent and carries with it the potential to alter history—both that of those who transform themselves and of the countless mortals that will inevitably suffer as a result of a lich's new power.

After its metamorphosis, a lich often finds some quiet place to dwell, typically protected by a variety of guardians and traps, for two primary purposes. First, a lich requires solitude in order to plan its elaborate schemes, and second, few mortals (if any) deign to interact with these legendarily corrupt necromancers. One reason begets the other, as the self-imposed isolation of a lich often drives the lich insane, further solidifying its separation from civilization. The longer a lich lives, the more meticulous a planner it becomes, secreting itself within a labyrinth of deadly puzzles, misdirection, and monsters. A lich's servants and guardians are absolutely loyal, either due to their nature (such as constructs or other undead) or as a result of compulsion using powerful magic. Many liches go mad, in time, and the nature of a lich's lair is a good indicator of the undead's current mental state.

For all the protections it arrays around itself, a lich will go to greater lengths to guard its phylactery, as it knows that the destruction of this magical container spells doom for the lich. A lich is notoriously difficult to bargain with, though the threat of damaging its phylactery is a sure way to gain the upper hand in such a negotiation.
Teyam Ishtori.saveDetails: +1 status to all saves vs. vitality

action->Torpor.name: Torpor
action->Torpor.description: Typically, a demilich is inert when encountered and doesn't take actions until its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WG91Z5TiR6oO5FOw]{Contingency} reaction has been triggered.

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Vital.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Vitality

action->Contingency.name: Contingency
action->Contingency.description:
Teyam has one permanent 8th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WG91Z5TiR6oO5FOw]{Contingency} spell in effect with one of its arcane innate spells of 5th level or lower as the companion spell- typically @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]{Translocate}.

Trigger While Teyam is in torpor, a creature disturbs Teyam's remains, touches her treasure, or casts a spell that would affect Teyam.

Effect Teyam ends torpor, rolls initiative, and gains the effect of her contingency's companion spell. The contingency resets after 24 hours.

action->Countermeasures.name: Countermeasures
action->Countermeasures.description:
Trigger Teyam's turn begins.

Effect Teyam casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.zR67Rt3UMHKC5evy]{Flicker}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.A2JfEKe6BZcTG1S8]{Fly}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OOELvfkTedBMlWtq]{Spell Turning}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.uqlxMQQeSGWEVjki]{Truesight} on itself. It usually chooses spell turning unless it already has that spell in effect.

action->Telekinetic Whirlwind.name: Telekinetic Whirlwind
action->Telekinetic Whirlwind.description: 20 feet. Telekinetic whirlwind activates when Teyam ends torpor. Loose debris in the area whip up into a whirling storm. This obscures vision, making any creature in the area concealed, and causes creatures in its area (except Teyam) to treat all creatures as concealed. Any creature other than Teyam that enters or begins its turn in the aura takes @Damage[2d12[bludgeoning]] damage.

action->Demilich Eye Gems.name: Demilich Eye Gems
action->Demilich Eye Gems.description:
A demilich has gemstone eyes that glow when the demilich is active. Each eye contains an 8th-rank spell that targets one creature (usually one eye has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Oj1PJBMQD9vuwCv7]{Quandary} and the other @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.BKIet436snMNcnez]{Polar Ray}). The demilich can Activate an eye. This uses the number of spellcasting actions the spell requires, and also requires command and envision components.

When the demilich casts a spell from a gemstone eye, that eye stops glowing for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}, during which time that eye's spell can't be used. Occasionally, one or both of the two @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Q4o8pEdxSY0bnJQZ]{Demilich Eye Gems} can be harvested from a destroyed demilich as magic items.

action->Devour Soul.name: Devour Soul
action->Devour Soul.description:
Requirements A soul has been trapped in one of Teyam's blight quartz gems for 24 hours.

Effect Teyam consumes the soul. The soul is utterly destroyed, and Teyam regains HP equal to double the creature's level.

action->Mental Magic.name: Mental Magic
action->Mental Magic.description: Teyam can replace all material and somatic components for casting spells with verbal components, and can replace all Interact components for activating magic items with envision components.

action->Staff Gems.name: Staff Gems
action->Staff Gems.description: Teyam long ago absorbed the spells from a staff into gemstone nodules embedded in her skull, with larger nodules representing higher-rank spells. She can cast any of the spells as though it were Activating the staff, and regains 1 charge per 4 hours spent in torpor, to a maximum of 10 charges. Teyam has the spells from a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.6m9niDjhA6tBfp5x]{Staff of Power}

action->Trap Soul.name: Trap Soul
action->Trap Soul.description:
Frequency once per day per gem

Effect Ten blight quartz gemstones on Teyam's skull can trap the souls of the living. The Activated gem casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GYmXvS9NJ7QwfWGg]{Seize Soul}. This bind soul can target and affect a dying creature instead of a corpse. The dying creature can attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:43] save; if it succeeds, it doesn't die and its soul is not trapped but it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (or is unaffected entirely on a critical success). When the soul of a creature gets trapped, the creature's body swiftly turns to dust.

The gemstones work like the black sapphires used in bind soul, except that they can hold creatures of up to 17th level and have a value of 200 gp apiece. Teyam can Devour a Soul it has trapped.

Tixitog.name: Tixitog
Tixitog.publicNotes:
Tixitogs are a species of bizarre aberrations that make their homes in the dens of giant spiders. Immune to poison and able to traverse sticky webs thanks to the thick slime that covers their bodies, tixitogs steal food cocooned in spider lairs and prey on spiders themselves, but they are careful never to kill so many that their food supply runs out. Their favorite meal, however, is the odd adventurer or spelunker who stumbles into their nest.

These strange creatures have oblong bodies coated in a viscous and transparent slime, three large black eyes, and eight thick, multi-jointed limbs, four of which are inverted and point upward, allowing the monster to easily crawl on either the ceiling or floor of narrow caverns and squeeze through narrow spaces. Their jaws appear small and tubular when closed but peel apart and stretch to terrifying proportions when opened, as their dozens of pointed teeth part to reveal a freakishly long tongue.

A tixitog usually hides from the spiders in the lair it has claimed, not out of fear but to keep the spiders from abandoning the lair and moving elsewhere. When a tixitog emerges from the shadows, most spiders flee from it rather than attack, and the tixitog uses this behavior to direct entire swarms of spiders where it pleases. This is typically bad news for bands of adventurers who find themselves within a tixitog's lair; in the mass hysteria caused by a skittering swarm of spiders headed straight toward them, spelunkers typically fail to notice the more dangerous threat that follows closely behind.

action->Web Sense (Imprecise) 60 feet.name: Web Sense (Imprecise) 60 feet
action->Web Sense (Imprecise) 60 feet.description: The tixitog can detect the vibrations of creatures touching a web that the tixitog is also touching.

action->Swallow Whole.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.uJSseLa57HZYSMUu]

Small, @Damage[(1d12 + 3)[bludgeoning]], Rupture 10

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SwallowWhole]

action->Tongue Pull.name: Tongue Pull
action->Tongue Pull.description: When a tixitog hits a Small or smaller creature with its tongue Strike, the target is pulled into the tixitog's mouth. The tixitog can then attempt to Swallow it Whole.

Town Hall Fire.name: Town Hall Fire
Town Hall Fire.description: A fire engulfs the western door and a @Template[line|distance:10|width:10]{10-foot-by-10-foot area} immediately east of it, then spreads on each of its turns.
Town Hall Fire.disable:
Eliminating the hazard requires dousing the flames. Water typically clears a 5-foot square if the amount is small (such as that from @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WzLKjSw6hsBhuklC]{Create Water} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.jfVCuOpzC6mUrf6f]{Hydraulic Push}). Larger amounts of water, such as a full bucket, typically douse a @Template[line|distance:10|width:10]{10-foot-by-10-foot area} (or 4 squares in some other shape). Throwing a bucket of water on flames requires an Interact action. A waterskin doesn't contain enough water to put out even 1 square of fire. Cold can also put out fire, but only if the cold can affect an area; cold is usually less effective than water, so a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.EpxmUtLpCkE8R6KJ]{Frost Vial} typically puts out 1 square of fire, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gYjPm7YwGtEa1oxh]{Ray of Frost} is ineffective.

Fountain Circle, located outside town hall, has several working water pumps. These are far enough away that it's impractical for a PC to bring water back and forth. However, a PC might instruct the more steely nerved spectators to create a bucket brigade. It takes 15 spectators (which can include those rescued by councilors as well as by PCs) to set this up, and 2 rounds for the townspeople to line up and begin pumping water from Fountain Circle. As of the 3rd round, there is a bucket of water available for the PCs to use at the chamber's southern entrance at the beginning of each PC's turn. Members of a bucket brigade are lined up outside the chamber, and don't take damage from smoke inhalation.

If a PC does want to carry the water, it's 150 feet from the chamber's southern door to a pump, so it 6 actions are usually needed to reach the pumps or return. Filling a bucket requires an Interact action.

Other methods might also help control the fire, as you determine. For example, the PCs might be able to find something to barricade the fire with to control its path, or use a cloak to beat out some of the fire.
Town Hall Fire.routine:
On its turn, the fire spreads into a number of additional squares equal to half the number of squares the fire currently occupies, with a minimum of 1 square. You determine the squares the fire spreads into-typically those with the most flammable materials. Any creature that ends its turn next to the flames takes @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage, and any creature within the flames takes @Damage[4d6[fire]] damage. Both of these have a @Check[reflex|dc:17|basic|traits:complex,environmental,fire,hazard] save. A creature can take damage from flames only once per round. (For simplicity, track damage only for the NPCs and their allies, not for the spectators; Turn 5 and Turn 7 have instructions regarding the spectators' health).

The fire has an additional effect on each of its turns after the first.

Turn 2 The chamber's northern door flies open and flames burst through, igniting the @Template[line|distance:10|width:10]{10-foot-by-10-foot area} in front of the door. All fires spread on subsequent turns, at the same rate listed above. Any fires that join together become one fire for this purpose.

Turn 4+ Creatures in the room take [[/r 1d6 #Smoke Inhalation Damage]]{1d6 damage} from smoke inhalation at the ends of their turns. Anyone who uses an Interact action to tie a wet rag around their nose and mouth (or uses another creative solution) halves the damage.

Turn 5 Spectators still inside the room fall @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} from burns and smoke inhalation.

Turn 7 Spectators still in the room die.

Trapped Lathe.name: Torno Aprisionador
Trapped Lathe.description: As molas do torno motorizado foram criticamente sobrecarregadas de modo que, ao serem agitadas ou acionadas, o torno se desenrola violentamente, arremessando lâminas, engrenagens e estilhaços de metal afiados pela sala.
Trapped Lathe.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:31|name:Liberar a Tensão da Mola|traits:complex,mechanical,trap,hazard] (perito) no torno libera a tensão de suas molas sem disparar suas lâminas e engrenagens.
Trapped Lathe.routine: (4 ações) O torno tenta quatro ataques de fragmentos afiados contra criaturas na sala, selecionando um alvo aleatoriamente de todos os alvos disponíveis na área A1. A armadilha não sofre penalidades de ataque múltiplo para nenhum de seus ataques. A armadilha perde 1 ação a cada turno à medida que suas molas se descontraem e fica desativada quando tiver 0 ações.
Trapped Lathe.stealth: (perito); @Check[perception|dc:29|name:Notar a Linha de Corda|traits:complex,mechanical,trap,hazard] para notar a linha de corda que vai do gatilho do torno em direção à porta da área A2.

action->Unleash Fragments.name: Liberar Fragmentos
action->Unleash Fragments.description:
Gatilho O torno é agitado ou danificado, ou seu gatilho é puxado remotamente.

Efeito A armadilha faz um Strike de fragmento afiado contra um alvo aleatório na área A1 e então rola iniciativa.

action->Persistent Bleed Critical.name: Sangramento Persistente Crítico
action->Persistent Bleed Critical.description: Os fragmentos afiados causam @Damage[1d8[bleed]] em um acerto crítico.

Tree of Dreadful Dreams.name: Árvore dos Sonhos Terríveis
Tree of Dreadful Dreams.description: A estátua do salgueiro se anima, seus galhos chicoteando para tentar agarrar qualquer um na área B2.
Tree of Dreadful Dreams.disable: @Check[athletics|dc:25|name:Forçar a Abertura de um Galho|traits:complex,magical,trap,hazard,action:force-open] ou @Check[thievery|dc:25|name:Alavancar a Abertura de um Galho|traits:complex,magical,trap,hazard] (treinado) para forçar ou alavancar a abertura de um único galho, desativando esse galho e libertando qualquer criatura presa dentro. @Check[thievery|dc:29|name:Interromper a Animação Mágica da Árvore|traits:complex,magical,trap,hazard] (perito) para interromper a animação mágica da árvore, desligá-la e libertar todas as criaturas presas. Colocar uma pedra dos sonhos no tronco da árvore requer 2 ações de Interagir e faz com que a armadilha se desligue, libertando todas as criaturas presas. Colocar a pedra dos sonhos amaldiçoada da área B4 no tronco, em vez disso, aumenta as ações da árvore por turno para 4 e concede um bônus de item de +2 em todos os testes de resistência e rolagens de ataque.
Tree of Dreadful Dreams.reset: A armadilha desativa e reinicia se não tiver criaturas @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Agarradas} e nenhuma criatura na sala para atacar. Se uma pedra dos sonhos não amaldiçoada for colocada em seu tronco, a estátua não reativará.
Tree of Dreadful Dreams.routine: (3 ações) A estátua usa cada ação para tentar um Strike de galho contra uma criatura aleatória na sala que ela não tenha @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Agarrado}. Se não houver criaturas para atacar e ela tiver pelo menos uma criatura agarrada, ela, em vez disso, Constringe. A armadilha pode ter até seis criaturas agarradas.

@Damage[(1d10+12)[bludgeoning]] damage.

@Check[fortitude|dc:27|basic]

action->Terrifying Visions.name: Visões Aterradoras
action->Terrifying Visions.description: Uma criatura que começa seu turno agarrada pela armadilha experimenta visões vívidas e distorcidas de eventos reais e deve obter sucesso em um salvamento de @Check[will|dc:31|traits:damaging-effect] ou sofrer @Damage[4d8[mental]] de dano. Em uma falha crítica, a criatura também se torna @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Condenada 1}. Uma criatura que obtiver sucesso em seu salvamento fica temporariamente imune por 24 horas.

action->Attack of Opportunity (Special).name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.hFtNbo1LKYCoDy2O]

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.AttackOfOpportunity]

action->Independent Limbs.name: Membros Independentes
action->Independent Limbs.description: Qualquer criatura atingida pelo Strike de Galho da árvore fica @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Agarrada}. Além disso, os Strikes de Galho da árvore não sofrem de penalidades de ataque múltiplo.

shield->Steel Shield.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Yr9yCuJiAlFh3QEB]

Like wooden shields, steel shields come in a variety of shapes and sizes. Though more expensive than wooden shields, they are much more durable.

Hardness HP BT
5 20 10

equipment->Winged Boots.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.aKoMqPDmVzPI7Q20]
Winged Boots
equipment->Winged Boots.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.aKoMqPDmVzPI7Q20]

Made from soft leather, with delicate white wings attached to the heel, these boots are ensorcelled with powerful air magic.

Whenever you fall while wearing these boots, the boots automatically cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.TTwOKGqmZeKSyNMH]{Gentle Landing} on you. This benefit can't trigger again for 10 minutes.

Activate 2 command, Interact

Frequency once per day

Effect You speak a command word and click the boots' heels together to cause the wings to animate and flap rapidly, granting you a fly Speed of 30 feet for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.1S51uIRb9bnZtpFU]{Effect: Winged Boots}

action->Perfect Will.name: Perfect Will
action->Perfect Will.description: If Uri rolls a success on a Will saving throw, he gets a critical success instead; if he rolls a critical failure on a Will save, he gets a failure instead.

action->Punish Imperfection.name: Punish Imperfection
action->Punish Imperfection.description:
Trigger A creature within Uri's reach fails an attack roll, saving throw, or skill check

Effect Uri makes an unarmed Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack hits, the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:41] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3} until the end of its next turn (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 4} on a critical failure).

action->Reactionary.name: Reactionary
action->Reactionary.description: Uri can use 2 reactions in a round, but he can't perform the same reaction more than once per round.

action->Slash and Slam.name: Slash and Slam
action->Slash and Slam.description: Uri makes two Strikes: one with his scimitar and one with his shield spikes. If both hit, the overwhelming power of the attack leaves the target @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} if one of the Strikes was a critical hit, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3} if both Strikes were critical hits). These Strikes count as one attack for Uri's multiple attack penalty, and the penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks.

action->Swift Capture.name: Swift Capture
action->Swift Capture.description:
Requirements Uri has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.5zkoqnp6X5yPCXVy]{Manacles} in his possession and is adjacent to a creature

Effect Uri sheathes a weapon he's carrying, then attempts to bind the creature's wrists or ankles with the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.5zkoqnp6X5yPCXVy]{Manacles}. If Uri succeeds at an attack roll with a [[/r 1d20+36 #Manacles]]{+36 modifier} against the target's AC, he applies the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.5zkoqnp6X5yPCXVy]{Manacles}.

action->Swift Slash.name: Swift Slash
action->Swift Slash.description: Uri Strides and makes a scimitar Strike at any point during the Stride.

Vaklish.saveDetails: +2 de status em todos os salvamentos contra magia, +3 de status em todos os salvamentos contra magia divina

spell->Dancing Lights.name: Luzes Dançantes
spell->Dancing Lights.description: Você cria até quatro luzes flutuantes, nenhuma das quais a mais de 3 metros uma da outra. Cada uma emite luz como uma tocha. Quando você Sustenta a Magia, pode mover qualquer número de luzes em até 18 metros. Cada luz deve permanecer a até 36 metros de você e a até 3 metros de todas as outras, ou se apaga.

consumable->Wand of Vampiric Exsanguinat.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.kiXh4SUWKr166ZeM]
Wand of Vampiric Exsanguination (Level 6)
consumable->Wand of Vampiric Exsanguinat.consumableSpellDescription:
Você atrai o sangue e a força vital de outras criaturas através de seus braços estendidos. Você causa 12d6 de dano de energia negativa a criaturas vivas na área. Você ganha Pontos de Vida temporários iguais à metade do dano que uma única criatura sofre desta magia; calcule esses Pontos de Vida temporários usando a criatura que sofreu o maior dano. Você perde quaisquer Pontos de Vida temporários restantes após 1 minuto.

Potencializada (+1) O dano aumenta em 2d6.
consumable->Wand of Vampiric Exsanguinat.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.kiXh4SUWKr166ZeM]

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.fd31tAHSSGXyOxW6]{Vampiric Exsanguination}

This baton is about a foot long and contains a single spell. The appearance typically relates to the spell within.

Activate Cast a Spell

Frequency once per day, plus overcharge

Effect You Cast the Spell at the indicated level.

Craft Requirements Supply a listed-level casting of the spell.

Note: To create a scroll or wand of a specific spell, drag the spell from the compendium or compendium browser into the inventory of a PC, NPC, or loot actor.

action->Scoff at the Divine.name: Zombar do Divino
action->Scoff at the Divine.description:
Gatilho Uma criatura a até 9 metros lança uma magia divina ou usa uma habilidade divina.

Requisitos Vaklish tem um espaço de magia não gasto que pode ser usado para lançar @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dissipar Magia}.

Efeito Vaklish gasta um espaço de magia que poderia ser usado para lançar dissipar magia e tenta contra-atacar a magia ou habilidade que acionou o efeito.

Vaklish não pode Zombar do Divino por [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Scoff at the Divine]]{1d4 rodadas}.

action->Change Shape.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.eQM5hQ1W3d1uen97]

Vaklish takes on the appearance of any Medium humanoid. This doesn't change Valish's Speed or the attack and damage modifiers with his Strikes but might change the damage type his Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning). He typically loses his fangs Strike unless the humanoid form has fangs or a similar unarmed attack.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

action->Disturbing Vision.name: Visão Perturbadora
action->Disturbing Vision.description:
Os olhos de Vaklish brilham em verde enquanto ele projeta uma onda telepática em uma @Template[emanation|distance:30]. Todas as criaturas na área são assaltadas por uma visão de decadência maligna de uma das vidas passadas do rakshasa. Cada criatura não maligna na área deve obter sucesso em um salvamento de @Check[will|dc:32] ou ficar @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Enjoada 1} (e @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Atordoada 1} em uma falha crítica).

As visões duram [[/gmr 1d4 #Duration Disturbing Vision]]{1d4 rodadas} e, enquanto duram, Vaklish e todas as criaturas malignas na área ganham um bônus de status de +1 em todos os testes. Vaklish só pode usar esta habilidade novamente depois que as visões anteriores terminarem.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.AThOnEYzPO9ssYTB]{Efeito: Visão Perturbadora}

Vazgorlu.name: Vazgorlu
Vazgorlu.publicNotes: The arthropod monstrosity known as a vazgorlu makes its home on the Astral Plane or inside of a stable portal, ambushing creatures that travel there using dimensional magic.

spell->Plane Shift (To and From the Vazg.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5bTt2CvYHPvaR7QQ]
Plane Shift (To and From the Vazgorlu's Demiplane Only)
spell->Plane Shift (To and From the Vazg.target: 1 willing creature, or up to 8 willing creatures joining hands

spell->Air Walk (Constant).name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.b5sGjGlBf58f8jn0]
Air Walk (Constant)

spell->Dimension Door (At Will).name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]
Dimension Door (At Will)

action->Hostile Juxtaposition.name: Hostile Juxtaposition
action->Hostile Juxtaposition.description:
Trigger A creature targets the vazgorlu with a Strike

Effect The vazgorlu chooses a different creature within 60 feet and attempts to swap places with that creature using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]{Translocate} in the instant before the Strike. The target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:39|traits:arcana] save.

Critical Success The target resists the teleportation, and the vazgorlu can't use Hostile Juxtaposition for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Hostile Juxtaposition]]{1d4 rounds}.

Success The target resists the teleportation.

Failure The target and the vazgorlu instantly swap places, and the triggering Strike is resolved against the target instead.

Critical Failure As failure, but the target is transported to the vazgorlu's demiplane after resolving the triggering Strike against it.

action->Demiplane Lair.name: Demiplane Lair
action->Demiplane Lair.description: A vazgorlu maintains a 30-foot-diameter demiplane in the Astral Plane. Gravity in this demiplane pulls out from the center, so that creatures can walk upon the inner surface. A vazgorlu's demiplane lair lacks a built-in point of exit, and if the vazgorlu fails to visit the demiplane during a 24-hour period, the demiplane collapses- all objects and creatures within are then returned to their original locations in the multiverse before they entered the demiplane. A vazgorlu can create a replacement demiplane lair with 24 hours of concentration.

action->Dimensional Tether.name: Dimensional Tether
action->Dimensional Tether.description: A creature hit by a vazgorlu's web Strike is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} and stuck to the nearest surface until it Escapes (DC 42). As long as it remains immobilized by the web, the web attempts to counteract any effect that would move the webbed creature to another plane, with a counteract rank of 10 and using the vazgorlu's [[/r 1d20+38 #Dimensional Tether Counteract]]{Arcana} skill to attempt the counteract check.

action->Redirect Portal.name: Redirect Portal
action->Redirect Portal.description: A vazgorlu can spend 10 minutes in contact with a magical portal to redirect it, causing the portal to instead lead to its demiplane lair. To do so, the vazgorlu must succeed at a [[/r 1d20+41 #Redirect Portal]]{Portal Lore} check (the DC is either equal to the caster's spell DC for a portal created by a spell, or set by the portal's level; if the portal in question has no level listed, assume it's a 20th-level portal).

Veshumirix.name: Veshumirix
Veshumirix.saveDetails: +1 status to all saves vs. magic
Veshumirix.source: Pathfinder #148: Fires of the Haunted City
